data.text: Statement of Work Voorhees Cleaning Schedule- Pinnacle Building Services Inc. Summary Fidelity Information Services, LLC (“FIS”) is engaging Pinnacle Building Services, Inc. (“Pinnacle” or "Supplier") to provide professional cleaning services to the FIS Voorhees location in New Jersey. General Information Currency: USD Estimated Budget Amount (USD): 3 Year Term: Year 1: Year 2: Year 3: $157,896.48 $49,029.24 $52,599.84 $56,267.40 Work Location: Voorhees, New Jersey Timeline Estimated Start Date: 06/01/2019 Estimated End Date: 05/31/2022 Owner Information Owner: Edward Kelly Purchase Order #: 184010068103 Purchase Order Amount: $157,896.48 USD Vendor Information Supplier: Pinnacle Building Services, Inc. Point of Contact: Robert White Terms 1 Engagement Terms & Governance 1.1 This Statement of Work (“SOW”) defines services (“Services”) to be performed for and Work to be delivered on an individual project basis to FIS by Supplier under the FIS Independent Contractor Agreement (the “Agreement”) dated June 17, 2019. This SOW agreement is governed by, incorporated into, and made part of the terms and conditions of the Agreement. In the event of any conflict between the Confidential Voorhees Cleaning Schedule- Pinnacle Building Services, Inc. Page 2 of 7 SOW and the Agreement the SOW will prevail, solely to the extent of the inconsistency. The terms of this SOW are limited to the scope of this SOW and shall not be applicable to any other SOWs which may be executed and attached to the Agreement. Any references in this SOW to specific sections in the Agreement are solely for the convenience of the parties and are not intended to modify the Agreement. If the parties wish to modify any provisions of the Agreement, such modifications must be clearly stated, specifying the sections to be modified and how they are to be modified. Any such modifications shall apply only with respect to this SOW, and shall not affect any other existing or future SOWs. 2 Contract Change Management 2.1 The total scope of work for the project is defined in this SOW. FIS or Supplier may request specific changes to the original scope of work, at any time using a formal Change Request. All Change Request details will will include the following aspects: Cost, Schedule, Quality and Resource Load. The Change Request must provide reasonable details of the proposed change(s) and, if possible, the party's estimate of the effect (if any) of the proposed change(s) on the professional services fees, delivery dates, the manpower required and any other aspect of the Services for each Change Request. The receiving party will respond within 7 days of receipt of the Change Request, indicating whether or not it accepts the proposed change(s), and giving its own estimate of the effects which the proposed change(s) will have (including any costs and timing issues expected to arise in connection with evaluating the Change Request). Each party will respond to all further correspondence within 7 calendar days of receipt of previous correspondence. Neither party shall have any obligation respecting any proposed change(s) until an appropriate change order and resulting amendment to this SOW is executed by both parties. 3 Transition Assistance 3.1 In the event that Supplier is unable to complete the contracted SOW services, the Supplier on this SOW shall work with Client to expedite an orderly transfer of services to the new assuming Supplier. 4 Services 4.1 Daily Services Pinnacle’s employees shall perform the following duties on a weekly basis: A. COMMAND CENTER REMOVE TRASH AND GENERAL CLEANUP B. MAIN RESTROOMS Confidential Voorhees Cleaning Schedule- Pinnacle Building Services, Inc. Page 3 of 7 REMOVE TRASH, REFILL DISPENSERS, RESTOCK PAPER PRODUCTS, REMOVE DUST FROM HORIZONTAL SURFACES, CLEAN ANO DISINFECT, ALL UNITS, CLE AN MIRROR, CLEAN CHROME ACCESSORIES, CLEAN SINK, SCRUB CLEAN TOILETS & URINALS, SPOT CLEAN WALLS & PARTITIONS, MOP FLOOR WITH DISINFECTANT, AND POUR DISINFECTANT DOWN FLOOR DRAINS. C. CAFETERIA REMOVE TRASH, REFILL DISPENSERS AND RESTOCK PAPER PRODUCTS, REMOVE OUST FROM HORIZONTAL SURFACES, CLEAN AND DISINFECT ALL TABLES AND COUNTERS, CLEAN SINK, MOP FLOOR, VACUUM RUG; SPOT CLEAN WALLS; CLEAN APPLIANCES AND VERIFY CLEANLINESS OF CONFERENCE ROOMS D. HALLWAYS REMOVE DUST FROM HORIZONTAL SURFACES, SPOT CLEAN WALLS, SWEEP AND MOP FLOOR E. LOBBY REMOVE TRASH, SWEEP AND MOP FLOOR, REMOVE DUST FROM HORIZONTAL SURFACES, VACUUM/SWEEP MATS, CLEAN DOORS AND WINDOWS, EMPTY ENTRANCE RECEPTACLES, REPLACE BURNT OUT LIGHT BULBS AND ENSURE NO TRASH HAS ACCUMULATED AT ENTRANCE DOORWAY. F. LOADING DOCK DUMPSTER AREA CLEAN AND ENCLOSURE DOORS CLOSED, CARDBOARD DUMPSTER NOT OVERFLOWING, RECYCLE BINS ORDERLY SWEEP DOCK, REMOVE ANY TRASH BLOWN INTO DOCK AREA, EMPTY ENTRANCE RECEPTACLES AND REMOVE ANY STANDING WATER. G. OFFICE SPACE REMOVE TRASH, AND EMPTY RECYCLE CANS H. SINGLE RESTROOMS REMOVE TRASH, REFILL DISPENSERS, RESTOCK PAPER PRODUCTS, REMOVE DUST FROM HORIZONTAL SURFACES, CLEAN AND DISINFECT ALL UNITS, CLEAN MIRROR, CLEAN SINK, SCRUB CLEAN TOILETS, SPOT CLEAN WAL.LS, MOP FLOOR WITH DISINFECTANT, AND POUR DISINFECTANT INTO FLOOR DRAINS I. MAIN RESTROOMS (AFTERNOON) REMOVE TRASH, CLEAN AND DISINFECT ALL UNITS, CLEAN MIRROR, CLEAN SINK, SCRUB CLEAN TOILETS & URINALS AND MOP FLOOR WITH DISINFECTANT J. COMMAND CENTER (AFTERNOON} REMOVE TRASH AND GENERAL CLEANUP 4.2 Weekly Services Pinnacle’s employees shall perform the following duties on a weekly basis: Confidential Voorhees Cleaning Schedule- Pinnacle Building Services, Inc. Page 4 of 7 MONDAY I. PREPARE CARDBOARD FOR PICKUP II. FEP ROOM REMOVE TRASH, REMOVE DUST FROM HORIZONTAL SURFACES, CLEAN AIR VENTS, REPLACE BURNT OUT BULBS, SWEEP AND MOP FLOOR III. NETWORK CONTROL REMOVE TRASH, REMOVE DUST FROM HORIZONTAL SURFACES, CLEAN AIR VENTS, REPLACE BURNT OUT BULBS, SWEEP AND MOP FLOOR IV. TAPE OPERATIONS REMOVE TRASH, REMOVE DUST FROM HORIZONTAL SURFACES, CLEAN AIR VENTS, REPLACE BURNT OUT BULBS, SWEEP AND MOP FLOOR V. EMPTY ALL RECYCLE TRASH CANS IN BUILDING VI. MAIL/SHIPPING ROOM REMOVE TRASH, REMOVE OUST FROM HORIZONTAL SURFACES, CLEAN AIR VENTS, REPLACE BURNT OUT BULBS, SWEEP AND MOP FLOOR TUESDAY I. EXTERIOR REMOVE ANY TRASH IN LAWN & P ARKING LOT, CLEAN PICNIC AREA AND CLEAN EXTERIOR ENTRANCE GLASS II. ELECTRICAL ROOM REMOVE TRASH, REMOVE OUST FROM HORIZONTAL SURFACES, REPLACE BURNT OUT BULBS, SWEEP AND MOP FLOOR III. MANAGED HOSTING AREAS #1 & #2 REMOVE TRASH, REMOVE DUST FROM HORIZONTAL SURFACES, CLEAN AIR VENTS, REPLACE BURNT OUT BULBS, SWEEP ANO MOP FLOOR WEDNESDAY I. DATA CENTER REMOVE TRASH, REMOVE DUST FROM HORIZONTAL SURFACES, CLEAN AIR VENTS, REPLACE BURNT OUT BULBS, SWEEP AND MOP FLOOR, CLEAN OCC WINDOW THURSDAY I. EXTERIOR REMOVE ANY TRASH IN LAWN & PARKING LOT, CLEAN PICNIC AREA AND CLEAN EXTERIOR ENTRANCE GLASS II. MANAGED HOSTING AREA #4 REMOVE TRASH, REMOVE DUST FROM HORIZONTAL SURFACES, CLEAN AIR VENTS, REPLACE BURNT OUT BULBS, SWEEP ANO MOP FLOOR III. LOCKER ROOMS REMOVE TRASH, REMOVE DUST FROM HORIZONTAL SURFACES, CLEAN AIR VENTS, REPLACE BURNT OUT BULBS, SWEEP AND MOP FLOOR CLEAN ANO DISINFECT SHOWERS FRIDAY I. MANAGED HOSTING AREA #3 Confidential Voorhees Cleaning Schedule- Pinnacle Building Services, Inc. Page 5 of 7 REMOVE TRASH, REMOVE DUST FROM HORIZONTAL SURFACES, CLEAN AIR VENTS, REPLACE BURNT OUT BULBS, SWEEP AND MOP FLOOR II. 333/400 BLDGS CHECK CARDBOARD AND RECYCLE BINS III. ALL BLDGS INVENTORY CLEANING SUPPLIES, CAFETERIA SUPPLIES AND PAPER PRODUCTS. SUPPLY FACILITY MANAGER A LIST OF NEEDED SUPPLIES 5 Performance Management 5.1 Performance Management For the purposes of communicating performance expectations Supplier shall provide sufficient management to ensure the Services and deliverables are performed efficiently, accurately, on time, and in compliance with the requirements of this SOW and the Agreement. If there are any discrepancies, Supplier shall correct the discrepancies to FIS’s satisfaction. 6 Rates 6.1 Rates The services will be invoiced on a monthly basis by submitting invoices through Transcepta, at a rate of $4085.77 per month for the first year, $4383.32 per month for Year 2, and $4688.95 per month for Year 3. Expenses are not expected to be needed; however, if they are, written pre-approval is required prior to expense invoice submission. 7 Project Point of Contact 7.1 Supplier Contact The Pinnacle contact responsible for SOW delivery and the overall account management: Robert White bwhite@pimiacleservices.com 856-939-6880 Confidential Voorhees Cleaning Schedule- Pinnacle Building Services, Inc. Page 6 of 7 7.2 FIS Contact The FIS Contact responsible for engaging with Pinnacle’s timelines, assessing overall performance, and rendering approval of invoices submitted through Trancepta: Edward Kelly edward.kelly@fisglobal.com 609-238-5183 IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the parties have caused this Agreement to be executed by their duly authorized representatives. Date: July 31,2019 Print: Stefanie Capriola   Title: Supply Chain Manager  Confidential Voorhees Cleaning Schedule- Pinnacle Building Services, Inc. Page 7 of 7

value.text: In all cases, in performing its obligations under the Agreement, both Parties shall strictly comply with the provisions of the Personal Data Protection Act 2012 (Singapore), Republic Act No. 10173 or "the Data Privacy Act of 2012,” its implementing rules and regulations, and all other laws and government issuances which are now or will be promulgated relating to data privacy and the protection of personal information, including the Regulation (EU) 2016/679 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 27 April 2016 on the protection of natural persons with regard to the processing of personal data and on the free movement of such data (General Data Protection Regulation) or the European Union’s GDPR, and any relevant and applicable data protection and privacy laws and regulations issued in other jurisdictions by their respective competent authorities. All these applicable and relevant laws, rules, and regulations shall be collectively referred to as “Data Privacy Laws”.

value.text: . 6. FORCE MAJEURE Neither party shall be liable for any failure or delay in performance to the extent that performance of its obligations or attempts to cure any breach are delayed or prevented by reason of any act of God, fire, natural disaster, calamities, labor strikes and lockouts, civil strife or any similar occurrences beyond the reasonable control of the party unable to perform its obligations ("Force Majeure"). In the event of such a Force Majeure, the party unable to perform shall give the other party written notice within three (3) 6 of 25 PLDTSG Colocation Agreement  days of the occurrence of Force Majeure. In addition, the time for performance or cure shall be extended for a period equal to the duration of the Force Majeure but in no case to exceed three (3) months from such occurrence.

d) Notwithstanding anything to the contrary in this Agreement, either Parties’ maximum aggregate liability to other party relating to or arising under this Agreement will be limited to the amount of actual fees paid by the Customer to PLDTSG pursuant to this Agreement, in the three (3) months immediately preceding the occurrence of the event giving rise to the claim.

value.text: Term and Effectivity of Agreement: This Agreement shall have a term of five (5) year commencing on 30 August 2020 (the “Commencement Date”) up to 29 August 2025. This Agreement shall begin on the Commencement Date and unless terminated in accordance with Sections 7 or 8 of the Standard Terms and Conditions, shall continue for the minimum term of sixty (60) months (the “Term”). This Agreement shall be automatically renewed on a Monthly Basis unless the Customer gives PLDTSG written notice of not later than thirty (30) days prior to the expiration of the Term or the Renewed Term that it no longer desires to renew the Agreement.

TERMINATION a) In addition to Sections 7(b) (d) and (e), this Agreement may be terminated by any party upon written notice prior to the expiration of the Term in any of the following ways: (i) If any party becomes the subject of any voluntary proceedings under any bankruptcy or insolvency laws, or becomes the subject of any involuntary proceedings under any bankruptcy or insolvency laws which are not dismissed or withdrawn within sixty (60) days after the filing thereof. (ii) If any party has materially breached an obligation under this Agreement or any of its representations and warranties are inaccurate in any material respect, and such breach or inaccuracy is not cured within thirty (30) days after written notice thereof. 7 of 25 PLDTSG Colocation Agreement (iii) By PLDTSG if the Customer is in breach of its obligations under any agreement entered into with PLDTSG for the provisions of telecommunications or other services and such breach would entitle PLDTSG to terminate such agreement; (iv) By PLDTSG if the Customer is in breach of Sections 1(b), 1(d), 1(e), 1(f), 2(c), 4 and 9 of this Agreement or any provision of the Access Policy.

b) If this Agreement is terminated by PLDTSG for cause, the Customer shall be liable to PLDTSG for the terminated Services in the amount of thirty-five percent (35%) of the monthly recurring and related fees for the remainder of the Term. The Security Deposit under Section 4 (a) (ii) may be applied to such termination charges for such terminated Services. However, in the event the Customer terminates this Agreement within the Renewed Term, the foregoing 35% termination charges shall not be imposed, and the Security Deposit shall be reimbursed to the Customer. For the avoidance of doubt, if this Agreement is terminated by the Customer under Sections 7(b) (d) or (e), the Customer shall pay to PLDTSG all unpaid Service fees and charges for Services previously rendered, but shall otherwise have no further liability to PLDTSG.

TERMINATION a) In addition to Sections 7(b) (d) and (e), this Agreement may be terminated by any party upon written notice prior to the expiration of the Term in any of the following ways: (i) If any party becomes the subject of any voluntary proceedings under any bankruptcy or insolvency laws, or becomes the subject of any involuntary proceedings under any bankruptcy or insolvency laws which are not dismissed or withdrawn within sixty (60) days after the filing thereof. (ii) If any party has materially breached an obligation under this Agreement or any of its representations and warranties are inaccurate in any material respect, and such breach or inaccuracy is not cured within thirty (30) days after written notice thereof. 7 of 25 PLDTSG Colocation Agreement (iii) By PLDTSG if the Customer is in breach of its obligations under any agreement entered into with PLDTSG for the provisions of telecommunications or other services and such breach would entitle PLDTSG to terminate such agreement; (iv) By PLDTSG if the Customer is in breach of Sections 1(b), 1(d), 1(e), 1(f), 2(c), 4 and 9 of this Agreement or any provision of the Access Policy

data.text: COLOCATION AGREEMENT KNOW ALL MEN BY THESE PRESENTS: This Colocation Agreement ("Agreement”) is made and entered into this 301h day of Ju|y 2020 by and between: .   X&3& PLDT (SG) PTE LTD., a corporation duly organized and existing under and by virtueyof the laws of Singapore, with principal office address at 304 Orchard Road #02-37, Singapore 23863 , together with its subsidiaries and affiliates represented in this act by its Director, JEFFERSON G. MENDOZA (hereinafter referred to as "PLDTSG”); and FIS Global Trading (Singapore) PTE. LTD., a corporation duly organized and existing under and by virtue of the laws of Singapore, with principal office address at 8 Marina View #31-01, Asia Square Tower, Singapore 018960, together with its subsidiaries and affiliates represented in this act by its Manager, Global Procurement, Regine ong (hereinafter referred to as “Customer”) WHEREAS: A. PLDTSG, through its affiliate ePLDT, operates the Vitro™ Data Center located at the IDC Building, Carlos P. Garcia corner Canley Road, Barrio Ugong, Pasig City, Metro Manila (the “Premises”). B. PLDTSG desires to license to the Customer, and the Customer desires to license from PLDTSG, the right to use and occupy space within the Premises as defined in Schedule 1 (the "Colocation Space”) to locate certain equipment as specified in Schedule 2 (the "Equipment") owned by the Customer or by entities related to the Customer, and for the provision of the services set forth in Schedule 3 (the "Services”) all attached hereto and made integral parts of this Agreement; C. PLDTSG has agreed to provide the Colocation Space and Services, and the Customer has agreed to contract for the Colocation Space and the Services based upon the terms and conditions set forth herein. IT IS AGREED AS FOLLOWS: The Deal Terms and any attachments thereto (“Annex[es] and/or or Schedule[s]”) as well as the Standard Terms and Conditions shall hereinafter be referred to as the “Agreement”. In case of conflict between the Deal Terms with any attached Annex(es)/Schedule(s) and the Standard Terms and Conditions, the Deal Terms shall prevail. DEAL TERMS 1. Term and Effectivity of Agreement: This Agreement shall have a term of five (5) year commencing on 30 August 2020 (the “Commencement Date”) up to 29 August 2025. This Agreement shall begin on the Commencement Date and unless terminated in accordance with Sections 7 or 8 of the Standard Terms and Conditions, shall continue for the minimum term of sixty (60) months (the “Term”). This Agreement shall be automatically renewed on a Monthly Basis unless the Customer gives PLDTSG written notice of not later than thirty (30) days prior to the expiration of the Term or the Renewed Term that it no longer desires to renew the Agreement. Every renewal (the “Renewed Term”) shall be subject to the same terms and conditions contained herein except that there shall be a minimum escalation charge applied to the Monthly Recurring Fee equivalent to five per cent (5%) per annum, subject to mutual agreement by the parties. 1 of 25 PLDTSG Colocation Agreement 2. Monthly Recurring Fee: Customer shall be charged for the excess amperage at USD 34.00 in case the total rated amperages exceed per ampere per rack per month (or its equivalent in United States Dollars, as applicable). If there are increases in the actual rates of electricity on a per kilowatt hour basis (kwh) during the duration of this Agreement, the Customer shall be billed, on a pro-rata basis, for such increases in electricity cost immediately after such increases take effect. For purposes of billing, the parties herein mutually agree that the average electricity cost per kwh at the time of this Agreement is USD 0.18 per kwh. The manner for computing the monthly incremental electricity cost shall be based on the following formula: (Actual average cost of electricity per kwh minus average electricity cost per kwh at the time of this Agreement) multiplied by 3312 kwh per rack) 3. Set-up Period: Tentatively August 2020 actual date TBC it depends on the date we receive confirmation from FIS. 4. Fees and Billings: Refer to separate business order form. 5. Notices and Other Communications to Customer: Name: Matthew Bauer Designation: Head of Infrastructure Service Delivery, APAC Contact Nos. : +61 2 8224 0041 6. Special Provisions: Within thirty (30) days of the expiry of the Term or the Renewed Term (as the case may be), the Customer may notify PLDTSG that this Agreement will be extended or renewed for a further twelve (12) months or such other period, and upon such terms, as may be mutually agreed between the parties. Ifthis Agreement will not be extended, a formal letter of request or termination letter coming from the Customer's authorized signatory must be submitted to PLDTSG. For the avoidance of doubt, pursuant to Section 8(b), if this Agreement is terminated by the Customer during the duration of the Renewed Term, the Customer shall pay to PLDTSG all unpaid Service fees and charges for Services previously rendered, but shall otherwise have no further liability to PLDTSG. SCHEDULES: ( ) SCHEDULE 1: The Colocation Space ( ) SCHEDULE 2: The Equipment ( ) SCHEDULE 3: The Services ( ) SCHEDULE 4: Secure Access Policy ( ) SCHEDULE 5: The Fees 2 of 25 PLDTSG Colocation Agreement ( ) SCHEDULE 6: Service Level Agreement IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the Parties hereto through their authorized representatives have caused the execution of this Colocation Agreement with Schedules, including the Deal Terms and the Standard Terms and Conditions, on the date and at the place indicated herein and acknowledged in accordance with the formalities prescribed by law. FIS Global Trading (Singapore) Pte. Ltd. By: Name; Regine Ong Title: Manager, Global Procurement Signed in the presence of: Global Account Manager PLDT (SG) PTE LTD 3 of 25 PLDTSG Colocation Agreement STANDARD TERMS AND CONDITIONS 1. PERMISSIBLE USE OF COLOCATION SPACE a) On the Commencement Date, PLDTSG shall allow Customer to place Equipment within the Colocation Space, and Customer shall have the right to occupy the Colocation Space beginning on the said Commencement Date subject to the terms, covenants, restrictions, fees and conditions herein. The rights granted pursuant to this Section 1 are subject to the terms and conditions of any underlying lease or other superior right by which PLDTSG has acquired its interest over the Premises. Customer agrees that this Agreement does not and shall not grant to Customer any property rights in or to any portion of the Premises. Subject to Section 2(e), PLDTSG agrees that this Agreement does not and shall not grant to PLDTSG any property rights in or to any portion of the Equipment. b) Customer shall utilize the Colocation Space only for hosting its Equipment. Customer shall not use the Colocation Space for any unlawful or immoral purposes and any other purpose contrary to good customs, public order, public policy, or such purpose that will impair the purposes of this Agreement. c) The installation and operation of the Equipment by the Customer upon the execution of this Agreement shall be conclusive evidence that Customer accepts the Colocation Space on an “as is” basis and that the Colocation Space is in satisfactory condition and is suitable for the use intended by Customer at the time of the installation of the Equipment and commencement of this Agreement. d) Customer shall not make any construction changes or material alterations to the interior or exterior portions of the Colocation Space or Premises, including building of walls or partitions, drop ceilings, lighting, ventilation, air conditioning, plumbing or any electrical distribution or power supplies for the Equipment. PLDTSG shall exclusively perform and manage any construction or material alterations within the Colocation Space and Premises at rates to be negotiated between the parties hereto. e) The use by Customer of the Colocation Space, installation of Equipment, and access to the Premises shall at all times be subject to Customer’s adherence to standards for facility security and rules of conduct provided by PLDTSG in the attached Schedule 4 (“Access Policy”). f) Customer shall not market, license or sell Colocation Services in the Colocation Space to any third party without the prior written consent of PLDTSG (such consent not to be unreasonably withheld or delayed). If Customer should provide or attempt to make available to any third party the use of the Colocation Space without obtaining the prior written consent of PLDTSG, Customer shall be in material breach of this Agreement and PLDTSG may pursue any legal or equitable remedy under Section 8 of this Agreement. g) In the event of damage, destruction or condemnation of the Premises or Colocation Space, either party may request the other to relocate the Equipment to a location of comparable dimensions, satisfactory condition, and suitable for the intended use as stated in this Agreement. The costs of relocating the Equipment shall be borne solely by PLDTSG if such damage, destruction or condemnation of the Premises or Colocation Space is proven to be the fault or negligence of PLDTSG; otherwise, the costs shall be borne by PLDTSG and Customer equally. The Customer shall not, in any way, be liable for payment of increase in fees arising from the relocation of Equipment under this subsection. h) Upon Customer’s written request and for reasons other than those stated in Section 1(g) hereof, PLDTSG may agree to relocate the Equipment to another location within the Premises at Customer’s choice. PLDTSG may condition its approval of such relocation to Customer's acceptance of additional terms and conditions. In the event PLDTSG agrees to relocate the Equipment as a result of Customer’s request, all costs of relocation including Set-up Fees shall be borne by the Customer. Where Customer requests for its Equipment to be relocated to a space with a smaller area compared to the Colocation Space the monthly recurring fees chargeable to Customer shall remain the same. 4 of 25 PLDTSG Colocation Agreement 2. EQUIPMENT a) Delivery of Equipment. Customer shall arrange for the delivery of each unit of Equipment to the Colocation Space at Customer’s sole expense. Customer shall provide PLDTSG with no less than seven (7) days prior written notice of the actual delivery date. b) Installation and Removal of Equipment. Upon payment of the required Set-up Fee/One Time Charge specified in Schedule 5 and upon agreement on the schedule of the installation and set-up, Customer may install the Equipment at the Colocation Space on its own effort. Customer shall be given an adequate period as stated in the Deal Terms to install and set-up the Equipment in the Colocation Space (“Set-up Period"). If upon the expiration of the Set-up Period, the installation of the Equipment at the Colocation Space has not been completed, Customer agrees to pay PLDTSG additional Set-up Fee as specified in Schedule 5 for each day in excess of the Set-up Period. Should the Customer opt to request PLDTSG to install the Equipment at the Colocation Space, it shall pay PLDTSG additional service fees specified in Schedule 5 and the cost of any materials necessary for the installation of the Equipment. Customer may not install any other equipment at the Colocation Space, other than the Equipment, without PLDTSG’s prior written approval (such approval not be unreasonably withheld or delayed). Customer shall provide PLDTSG with written notification at least seven (7) days before Customer removes any Equipment and such removal shall be subject to PLDTSG’s verification that there are no outstanding charges due and payable by Customer to PLDTSG. Upon the Customer’s request, the seven-day notification shall be waived in emergency cases, such as where there is a need for the removal of the Equipment for immediate repair. c) Responsibility for Equipment and Colocation Space. Customer shall be solely responsible for the Equipment, which shall remain Customer’s sole property, and all software and data stored thereon (“Stored Information”). Unless otherwise specifically agreed in writing, PLDTSG shall have no duty to monitor, maintain or care for the Equipment or Stored Information. Customer shall protect, maintain and keep in good order and condition the Colocation Space and the Equipment, and shall ensure that neither Customer nor its agents or contractors damage any part of the Premises, the Colocation Space or any equipment located on or about the Premises. d) Inspection. PLDTSG or its agents may inspect or observe the Equipment at any time, subject to giving the Customer twenty-four (24) hours’ notice of the schedule of inspection or observation. If the Equipment is located in a security enclosure, Customer shall furnish PLDTSG the appropriate keys or access information needed to enter into the enclosure. e) Lien. PLDTSG may exercise a right of lien over the Equipment to secure payment of the monthly recurring charges, charges for additional services and penalties for late payment of said charges payable by the Customer to PLDTSG that remain unpaid after the due date. 3. UTILITIES, TECHNICAL AND SECURITY UNDERTAKINGS Subject to the provisions of the attached Schedule 6 (“Service Level Agreement”), PLDTSG shall at all times during the Term of this Agreement maintain or cause the maintenance of the back-up generator, electrical system and equipment, ventilation and air-conditioning system and equipment (collectively, “Utility Systems") serving the Colocation Space in good condition and repair, adequate at all times to provide and operate on a 24 hours, 7 days a week basis excluding scheduled maintenance and repairs of the Utility Systems. PLDTSG shall provide for the security and privacy of the Premises and Colocation Space, which includes the services of personnel to protect against unlawful entry and presence of unauthorized individuals in the Premises and Colocation Space and to monitor the physical security of the Premises and Colocation Space against fire and other emergency situations. PLDTSG shall strictly enforce the provisions of the Access Policy set forth in Schedule 4. 5 of 25 PLDTSG Colocation Agreement 4. FEES AND BILLINGS a) Customer shall pay PLDTSG a monthly recurring fee for the provision of the Colocation Space and Services as set forth in Schedule 5. b) If Customer requests that PLDTSG provide services not specified herein or in Schedule 3 (the “Services”), Customer agrees to pay PLDTSG’s then current standard charge for such service in effect at the time such service was rendered or such charge as the parties may mutually agree upon prior to the delivery of the service. c) Monthly recurring fees specified in Schedule 5 shall be payable in United States Dollars on the Payment Due Date in accordance with the billing sent by PLDTSG to Customer. For purposes of this agreement, the following definitions shall apply: Payment Due Date is 60 days from the end of the Billing Period or Billing Cycle. Billing Period or Billing Cycle is the period of time between billings; this starts every 1st day of each month and ends on the last day, 30th or 31st day, of the same month, or as may be stated in the billing statement. Payment Grace Period is the period of time between the end of the Billing Period or Billing Cycle and the Payment Due Date. The Colocation Space shall be provided through the Vitro™ Data Center. Vitro™ Data Center Colocation Space and facilities, to be provided for the Customer, shall include the following specifications and features: 1) Half racks and various bandwidth connectivity (See Schedule 5). 2) Availability of three (3) Uninterruptible Power Supply (UPS) in redundant and parallel mode. 3) Availability of redundant Generators to ensure continued operations of the Customer colocated data center hardware and equipment during commercial loss of power. A 300- gallon fuel day tank is available for providing eight (8) hours of continuous operation. And an underground tank with a 4,000 gallons capacity is available to ensure another fifteen (15) days of continuous operation. 4) Availability of redundant Precision Air-Conditioning Unit (PACU) to ensure consistent temperature and controlled humidity. The PACU is supported by three (3) 200-ton chillers backed-up by one (1) 200-ton chiller. 5) Provisions for gas-based fire suppression system to ensure the safety of all the equipments within the room during an event of fire outbreaks. The fire suppression systems are strategically located in the ceilings and under the floor void. 6) Building Security System to ensure the security and safety of hardware equipment and the personnel. The Colocation Space will be equipped with access control systems using swipe cards and biometric authentication. The security of the equipment rooms and personnel are constantly, on 24 x 7 duration, monitored by the Building Management System group. Video surveillance cameras are located in strategic locations of the Vitro™ Data Center building to ensure that the equipment areas, perimeter area and the entrances are constantly monitored. All charges for cables and other equipment shall be charged to the Customer. The Customer is prohibited from bringing, keeping, depositing, storing or otherwise introducing into the Premises and/or Colocation Space any obnoxious, flammable, toxic, poisonous, noxious or explosive substance or material or any article which may expose the Premises and/or Colocation Space to fire. Further, the Customer is prohibited from bringing, storing, keeping or introducing into the Premises and/or Colocation Space any item or contraband the possession, use, distribution or sale of which is prohibited by law, including but not limited to prohibited drugs, firearms, explosives, pornographic materials. 15. Customer undertakes that while in the Premises and/or Colocation Space, its Authorized Personnel and Additional Personnel strictly comply with and observe safety regulations imposed by Provider or those prescribed by law, ordinance or order of the local or national government of the Philippines, or those observed and/or practiced in the telecommunications/computer industry. 19 of 25 PLDTSG Colocation Agreement Failure to comply with the said safety regulations shall be at the exclusive risk and expense of the Customer. 16. Customer shall be responsible and liable for all acts of its Designated Officers, Authorized Personnel and Additional Personnel insofar as the enforcement of and compliance with the provisions of the Agreement and this Access Policy, as may be modified from time to time, are concerned. Any damage or injury to the Premises, Colocation Space, Provider or its employees, or any third person resulting from or arising out of any and all acts or omissions of Designated Officers, Authorized Personnel and/or Additional Personnel shall be the sole liability of the Customer. Any damage or injury to the Equipment proven as resulting from any and all acts of the Provider’s employees shall be the provider’s liability. 20 of 25 PLDTSG Colocation Agreement SCHEDULE 5 The Fees PLDTSG price for Customer Colocation requirements as set out in the Colocation Agreement between the parties are stated below. All Prices quoted are EXCLUSIVE of Value-Added taxes (VAT). All prices for Vitro™ Data Center Colocation Services are quoted in United States Dollars. Actual Price refer to commercial proposal. Advance Fee: WAIVED Security Deposit: WAIVED Settlement: All payments due to PLDTSG shall be remitted by CUSTOMER to the following bank details: Account Name: PLDT (SG) Pte Ltd Address: 304 Orchard Rd. #02-37, Singapore 238863 Bank Name: HSBC Singapore Address: 21 Collyer Quay #01-01 Account Number: 260-149976-178 ABA Routing No.:  SWIFT: HSBC SGSG 21 of 25 PLDTSG Colocation Agreement SCHEDULE 6 Service Level Agreement PLDT (SG) Pte Ltd ("PLDTSG”), is committed to providing reliable, high-quality Internet data center ("IDC”) infrastructure and services to its Customers. The guarantees in this Service Level Agreement ("SLA”) are part of such commitment and demonstrate PLDTSG’s willingness to stand behind our internal processes, our network and the quality of our service, as described below. This SLA likewise provides certain rights and remedies regarding the availability of PLDTSG’s Internet data center infrastructure and certain services. The following SLA terms and conditions apply only to eligible Colocation customers and dedicated server hosting customers ("Customers"). 1. Definition of Terms 1.1."Actual Service Availability" shall mean the difference between Service Availability Target and Downtime. 1.2. "Calendar Year" shall mean a period beginning from the start of the Term as defined and specified in the Customer's service agreement with PLDTSG (“Service Agreement”) and ending twelve (12) months thereafter. For Customers with Service Agreements having multiple-year Terms, the Term shall be divided into equal twelve-month Years for purposes of compliance with the terms of this SLA, beginning from the start of the Term until the end thereof. 1.3. “Scheduled Maintenance/Repairs” shall mean any maintenance at the PLDTSG data center at which Customer's server is located. Fifteen (15) calendar days prior notice of Scheduled Maintenance will be provided to Customer's designated point of contact by a method elected by PLDTSG (telephone, email, fax or pager), with Scheduled Maintenance date subject to approval or concurrence by the Customer. 1.4. "Downtime" shall mean the percentage of time in each Calendar Year in which the corresponding Internet data center or service component is not available or operational. This is calculated based on the amount of time recorded between the opening of a Trouble Ticket by PLDTSG in response to Customer's claim of PLDTSG downtime through the closing of the same Trouble Ticket by Vitro HelpDesk, when PLDTSG has resolved the PLDTSG downtime with a final fix or a temporary workaround. The closing of the Trouble Ticket shall be duly communicated to Customer by Vitro HelpDesk, and shall be considered valid, unless contested by Customer via e-mail to Techsupport@epldt.com and/or fax to (632) 6721330. Unless otherwise refuted by Customer, the time of Trouble Ticket closure by Vitro HelpDesk shall be used as reference for the computation of Downtime. "Trouble Ticket” is defined as the form generated by Vitro HelpDesk to record a problem identified by the Customer, verify that the record is accurate, attempt a resolution, and communicate the resolution to the Customer. 1.5. "Service Availability Target" shall mean the percentage of time in each Calendar year in which corresponding Internet data center or service component is available or operational. 1.6. “Host Server” shall mean the server(s) provided by PLDTSG for Customer’s use in line with its Dedicated Server Hosting requirements. This includes, but is not limited to, the following hardware components - central processing unit, memory, hard disk, power supply and network interface cards. 2. Service Availability Target 2.1. IDC Network Infrastructure PLDTSG guarantees that the internet data center network infrastructure ("IDC Network") will be operational at least 99.90% of the time in each Calendar Year (no more than 8 hrs, and 46 mins. downtime per year). Network infrastructure refers to internal data center network, demarcated by all border routers within a data center. Network uptime includes functioning of all network 22 of 25 PLDTSG Colocation Agreement infrastructure of the Internet data center including PLDTSG-provided routers, switches and cabling, but does not include services or software running on Customer’s server. 2.2. Facilities PLDTSG guarantees to supply AC power and air-conditioning to Customer- and/or PLDTSG- provided servers at least 99.95% of the time in each Calendar Year (no more than 4 hrs, and 23 mins, downtime per year). "Power Unavailability" consists of the number of minutes that power was not available to the server(s). 3. Responsibilities of Parties 3.1. For purposes of this SLA, Customer must immediately contact Vitro HelpDesk to report each occurrence of alleged Downtime, in order for an occurrence to be treated as Downtime. Immediately upon receipt of Customer’s notice of alleged Downtime, Vitro HelpDesk shall create a Trouble Ticket and inform the Customer right away of the corresponding Trouble Ticket number, which shall serve as PLDTSG’s confirmation of the Downtime. No Customer Credit will be issued for a period of service in which there was no formal notification (i.e, written notification via e-mail to Techsupport@epldt.com or telephone call to (632) 2888 999). 3.2. PLDTSG will use commercially reasonable good faith efforts to establish the cause of any alleged PLDTSG Downtime. If PLDTSG determines that the PLDTSG Service is in fact unavailable as defined herein, the event will be considered PLDTSG service outage time ("Service Outage”). 3.3. Customer must work with PLDTSG to resolve such issues related to the Downtime in a timely manner. 3.4. In the event of an outage caused by force majeure, PLDTSG will use commercially reasonable efforts to restore PLDTSG Service Availability. Fortuitous events and force majeure are defined as, in PLDTSG’s sole discretion, events beyond PLDTSG’s reasonable control including, but not be limited to, fire, flood, explosion, war, strike, embargo, government requirement or act, acts of civil or military authority, acts of God and inability to obtain necessary raw materials or supplies. 3.5. Problem Escalation and Response Targets 3.5.1 PLDTSG agrees to follow the classification of severity levels below and to use commercially reasonable efforts in working to meet the following response targets: SEVERITY LEVEL DEFINITION RESPONSE TARGET CONTACT One (1) This refers to a total service outage, which includes all of the following: □ Host Server □ IDC Network □ Facilities (i.e., AC Power and Air- conditioning) Immediate response within 30 mins. Frequency of updates on progress of troubleshooting is, at minimum, every 30 mins, or as needed. Incident report will follow within 24 hrs. or next working day. Vitro Data Center General Manager Two (2) This refers to partial service outage(s), which includes any of the following: □ Host Server □ IDC Network □ Facilities (i.e., AC Power and Air- conditioning) Frequency of updates on progress of troubleshooting is, at minimum, every 30 mins, or as needed. Incident report will follow within 24 hrs. or next working day. Project Manager and/or Account Manager 23 of 25 PLDTSG Colocation Agreement Three (3) This refers to service problems that cause non- critical degradation in service availability with no/low impact to Customer operations. Frequency of updates on progress of troubleshooting is, at minimum, every hour or as needed. Incident report will follow within 24 hrs. or next working day. Customer Support Group and/or concerned Support Group Head/engineer-in- charge 4. Customer Credits 4.1. Subject to the provisions of this Agreement, if PLDTSG fails to meet the above Service Availability Targets during any Calendar Year, PLDTSG shall provide a credit to Customer ("Customer Credit"), which shall be deducted from Customer’s total annual charges (computed as Monthly Recurring Fee x 12 months) and shall be Customer's sole and exclusive remedy for PLDTSG's failure to satisfy the Service Availability guarantees specified herein. The Customer Credit for a particular year shall be equivalent to two percent (2%) of the total annual charges for every two (2) percentage points’ shortfall in Actual Service Availability from the Service Availability Target. Actual Service Availability shall be calculated as follows: Actaal Service AvaBaHity = - 1 ~ 525,600 nwiirs >xl00% 4.2. Upon resolution of the problem, with a final fix or a temporary work around, and closure of Trouble Ticket, Customer must contact PLDTSG HelpDesk within five (5) business days to request a Customer Credit and reference the Trouble Ticket assigned. Failure to comply with this requirement will forfeit Customer's right to receive a credit. Any Customer Credit determined to be due by HelpDesk shall be credited towards the next month’s charges from receipt of request for Customer Credit. 4.3. If PLDTSG fails to comply with more than one Guarantee at the same period of time with respect to a Customer during a Calendar Year, only the Guarantee producing the greatest measured Customer Credit to such Customer shall be considered for the granting of Customer Credit. 4.4. The maximum annual credit shall not exceed fifty percent (50%) of the Customer's total annual charges. In the event the Customer would receive credits in any given year equal to fifty percent (50%) of the total annual charges, Customer shall have the option to cancel service at the time without penalty. 4.5. Customer shall not be entitled to Customer Credits unless Customer has paid PLDTSG all amounts due and is otherwise in full compliance with its corresponding service agreement with PLDTSG ("Service Agreement”). PLDTSG reserves the right to offset any Customer Credits owed to Customer against any amounts owed by Customer to PLDTSG. 4.6. Under NO circumstances shall Customer Credit be applied when: a) Customer is in breach, non-compliance or violation, of its Service Agreement during the Service Outage b) Service provided to the Customer is suspended due to accounts receivable policies c) Service is being modified per request of Customer d) Service is under Scheduled Maintenance 24 of 25 PLDTSG Colocation Agreement 5. Eligibility/Applicability of SLA 5.1. This SLA applies only to Customers agreeing to a minimum service period of one (1) year in their Service Agreement. 5.2. Downtime shall not be deemed to occur and calculation of Service Outage shall not include any unavailability (outlined in Section 2) caused by or associated with, in whole or in part, the following events if applicable: a) security breaches including, but not limited to, denial of service attacks, network floods, hacking or other security lapse (e.g. computer virus attacks from external sources via internet) on the Customer’s systems, equipment and network, and mail "bombs" or mail "spamming" (unsolicited e-mails) on the Subscriber's servers; b) Customer's acts or omissions, including without limitation, any negligence, willful misconduct, or use of PLDTSG’s services, systems, equipment and/or network in breach of Customer’s relevant Service Agreement; c) fortuitous events and force majeure (as defined in Section 3.4); d) inability of an PLDTSG staff to gain access to the Customer’s systems and/or premises for the purpose of fault rectification due to the Customer; e) network unavailability outside IDC Network and Fiber Optic Link, including but not limited to: ■ failure of any third-party telecommunications services provider(s) (e.g. cutting a fiber line somewhere); • failure of access circuits to the IDC Network and Fiber Optic Link, unless such failure is caused solely by PLDTSG; • restrictions on accessing underground facilities for specified dates and time (e.g. manholes/conduits) beyond PLDTSG’s reasonable control; ■ backbone peering point issues (e.g. having a router go down that wipes out internet service for the entire country) f) Emergency and Scheduled Maintenance/Repairs and/or upgrade activities; g) customer equipment, application and circuit malfunction and/or failure PLDTSG reserves the right to modify or amend this SLA at any time, subject to thirty (30) days’ prior written notice to Customer and with the Customer’s prior written consent (which consent shall not be unreasonably withheld or delayed). Except as set forth in this SLA, PLDTSG makes no claims or warranties regarding Service Availability. Specific terms of this SLA may be adjusted on a case-to-case basis in accordance with the relevant Service Agreement for certain Customers. This SLA shall thus be interpreted in accordance with and is made expressly subject to the terms of the relevant Service Agreement. In case of inconsistency between the terms of this SLA and the Customer’s Service Agreement, the relevant terms of the Service Agreement shall prevail over this SLA. This SLA shall in no way be interpreted to amend or modify the terms of the Customer’s Service Agreement. 25 of 25 PLDTSG Colocation Agreement

AMENDMENT TO ENGAGEMENT LETTER This Amendment (“Amendment”), effective as of July 1,2021 (“Amendment Effective Date”), is by and between FIS Capital Markets US LLC (“Client”) and PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP (“PwC”) and is made to the engagement letter between Client and PwC dated August 4, 2017 (the “Engagement Letter”) BACKGROUND A. The parties executed the Engagement Letter in connection with Fiduciary Tax Reporting Services provided by PwC to Client. B. The parties desire to extend the term of the Engagement Letter, as more fully described herein. NOW, THEREFORE, in consideration of the foregoing and intending to be bound hereby, the parties agree as follows: 1. Extension: Notwithstanding the paragraph in the Engagement Letter entitled “Timeframe,” the term of the Engagement Letter shall be extended for one (1) Agreement Year (as defined in the Engagement Letter), for the period July 1,2021 until June 30, 2022, at which time the Engagement Letter will terminate. 2. Fees: Exhibit B of the Engagement Letter is deleted and replaced with a new Exhibit B, attached hereto as Attachment 1 (Per Account Fees - 2021 Returns), which is incorporated herein and in the Engagement Letter by this reference. Except as set forth herein, the terms and conditions of the Engagement Letter shall remain in full force and effect; provided, however, that if any term or condition of the Engagement Letter conflicts with or is inconsistent with any term or condition of this Amendment, the terms and conditions of this Amendment shall govern, prevail and be controlling with respect to such conflict as it relates to the subject matter of this Amendment. IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the parties have caused this Amendment to be executed as of the Amendment Effective Date. FIS Capital Markets US LLC Pricewaterhouse Coopers LLP

data.text: •s * s * • FIS STATEMENT OF WORK This Statement of Work (“SOW’) is entered into as of 20th July, 2021 by and between Fidelity Information Services, LLC (“FIS") and REF Computer Corporation (“Provider"). This SOW defines the Services to be performed for and the Deliverables to be provided FIS by Provider pursuant to the terms of this SOW and the terms of the [insert master agreement name] dated 7/12/2021 between FIS and Provider (“Agreement"), which Agreement is expressly incorporated into this SOW by this reference. The terms of this SOW are limited to the scope of this SOW and shall not be applicable to any other statements of work which may be executed and attached to the Agreement. Terms capitalized and used in this SOW will have the meanings ascribed to them under the Agreement unless specifically provided for in this SOW otherwise. 1. TERM; TERMINATION ASSISTANCE 1.1. Term. The Term of this SOW shall commence on 1st August, 2021 (“SOW Effective Date”) and shall continue until 31st July, 2022 unless (a) earlier terminated pursuant to the terms of the Agreement or (b) renewed by the mutual written agreement signed by the parties. 1.2. Termination Assistance. In the event that FIS terminates this SOW due to Provider's failure to timely perform its obligations under this SOW, the parties will cooperate in good faith to develop a terminaton asistance plan prior to the expiration of the Term of this SOW to expedite an orderly transfer of Services to the new assuming third party service provider. The duration of termination assistance services will be no greater than six (6) months from the date of termination. 2. ENGAGEMENT REPRESENTATIVES 2.1. FIS Engagement Representative. Harshad Joshi VP, +91 9766397605 HarshadJoshi@fisglobal.com 2.2. Provider Engagement Representative. Alex Feld, VP 845-634-8251 x224 alex@refcomputer.com 3. OVERVIEW OF THE ENGAGEMENT FIS Retirement technology requires staffing support and Provider’s expertise on Provider’s SIP Enterprise and SEACS Solutions (“Provider Solutions”), and specific data conversion process knowledge and expertise to support New Business SIP Client Input (C) work for a FIS Client who has acquired Provider’s Solutions. Provider shall provide the Services described in this SOW to FIS. 4. SCOPE OF SERVICES Business analysis, SEACS system use and configuration, SIP template development, small feature enhancements and testing as requested by FIS, and general plan conversion support and assistance for (i) onboarding and maintaining new and legacy SIP qualified and non-qualified plans; and (ii) migrating existing COBOL RPS plans onto the SIP Cl platform. The scope of service includes: 1. General Support Assistance a. SIP Template development b. SIP Training c. General questions d. Debugging assistance e. Project management FIS | REF Computer Corporation SOW Page 1 of 4 2. Production Support a. Urgent matters, including environment and application production support b. Out of hours work, deployment support c. Immediate, high priority issues 3. Customizations a. Defined project work supported with hours available 4. Migration Support a. Migration template support; a sub-category of General Support 5. New Business Support a. Support new plan onboarding, template creation and any required customization 6. CMR (Contribution Manager) a. All CMR support and customizations required 5. RESPONSIBILITIES 5.1. Provider Responsibilities. 5.1.1. Perform the Services between 9am - 5 pm Eastern Standard time Monday thru Friday except on FIS designated holidays and concurrent with the designated time zone. 5.1.2. Provide the dedicated Engagement Representative set forth in Section 2.2 above for the duration of the Engagement. The Engagement Representative will responsible for scheduling, coordinating and/or directly supervising necessary Provider Personnel or Provider subject matter experts (“SMEs”) that may be required to assist with the Engagement or perform activities in conjunction with the Services. 5.1.3. Request assistance from FIS when necessary 5.1.4. Promptly alert FIS of any issue that may impact the planned delivery schedule 5.2. FIS Responsibilities. 5.2.1. Provide remote access and suitable workspace, equipment, furniture, and IT infrastructure (including workstations, systems access, FIS-owned application environments, and data), as applicable and reasonably necessary for Provider to perform the Services described within this SOW. 5.2.2. Designate and provide reasonably necessary access during the Term of this SOW to the FIS individuals serving in project support roles, including the FIS Engagement Representative. 5.2.3. Provide such information, documentation, decisions, approvals and assistance as reasonably necessary for Provider’s performance of Services under this SOW. 5.2.4. Coordinate and direct the activities of Provider. 5.2.5. Promptly alert Provider of any issues that arise during the course of this SOW. 6. ASSUMPTIONS 6.1. Technology support representing 1.5 FTE’s is from a pooled group of the following Provider resources: - Alex Feld - Geety Reyes - Hansik Choi - Robert Feld FIS | REF Computer Corporation SOW Page 2 of 4 J » •• • FIS - Larry Kamenetsky - Andrew Karelus 6.2 Provider resources will have the appropriate skills and experience necessary to complete the tasks as required in the scope of services of this SOW. 7. DEPENDENCIES 7.1. Kev Personnel. The following Provider Personnel are essential to Provider timely performing the scope of the Services for the Engagement set forth in this SOW: Name • Role | Time per od/percentage of day dedicated to the SOW Balodis, Patricia T Technical Analyst | 100% 7.2. Location of Services and Production of Deliverables. The Provider will perform the Services via remote access to the FIS environment and will store the Deliverables under this SOW as designated by the FIS project team]. 7.3. [Intentionally Deleted] 7.4. Progress Monitoring and Reporting. Provider will provide the following reports to FIS as specified in the below table. In addition, FIS may require other reports from time to time as requested in writing by FIS as well as request regular meetings to discuss progress, quality and Acceptance Criteria with the Provider. The location, format, frequency, date, and time of such meetings shall be mutually agreed to by the parties. The agenda for each Weekly and Monthly Status Report Meeting will be determined by FIS and communicated to Provider sufficiently in advance of such meeting, and may include, without limitation, the following a. Reviewing operational, performance, cost and planning issues related to the Services; b. Open or newly identified operational issues or concerns of FIS or Provider; c. Accomplishments for the previous period and objectives for the next period; d. Review of reports; including any explanation for the cause of missed target dates, e. Open issues from previous meeting. Report Name Template or Instructions Frequency Due Date Weekly Status Report As mutually agreed upon by the Engagement Representatives Weekly Commencing upon SOW effective date Monthly Status report Breakdown of activities performed during the month Monthly Commencing upon SOW effective date 8. [Intentionally Deleted] 9. [Intentionally Deleted] 10. [Intentionally Deleted] 11. FEES AND EXPENSES The fees and costs for the Services shall be on a capped time and materials basis in accordance with the hours, hourly rate and total not to exceed professional services fee (“Not to Exceed Professional Services Fee”) described in the table below. FIS shall reimburse Provider for any pre-approved, reasonable and actually incurred travel expenses subject to the FIS travel and expense policy, and terms of the Agreement. All prices are reflected in U.S. dollars. Payments and invoices shall be made in accordance with the Agreement. FIS | REF Computer Corporation SOW Page 3 of4

You agree to install (if required), use and maintain the Equipment in accordance with Manufacturers' specifications and to use only those supplies, which meet such specifications. You shall engage Ricoh, its subsidiaries or affiliates, or an independent third party (the "Servicer") to provide maintenance and support services pursuant to a separate agreement for such purpose ("Maintenance Agreement"). To the extent not prohibited by applicable law, you agree to indemnify us, defend us and hold us harmless from all claims arising out of the death or bodily injury of any person or the damage, loss or destruction of any tangible property caused by or to the Equipment, except to the extent caused by our gross negligence or willful misconduct. You are responsible for any theft of, destruction of, or damage to the Equipment from any cause at all, whether or not insured, from the time of Equipment delivery to you until it is delivered to us at the end of the term of this Agreement. You agree to maintain insurance to cover the Equipment for all types of loss, including, without limitation, theft, in an amount not less than the full replacement value and you will name us as an additional insured and loss payee on your insurance policy. In addition, you agree to maintain comprehensive public liability insurance, which, upon our request, shall be in an amount acceptable to us and shall name us as an additional insured. Such insurance will provide that we will be given thirty (30) days advance notice of any cancellation. You agree to provide us with evidence of such insurance in a form reasonably satisfactory to us, If you fail to maintain such insurance or to provide us with evidence of such insurance, we may (but are not obligated to) obtain insurance in such amounts and against such risks as we deem necessary to protect our interest in the Equipment. Such insurance obtained by us will not insure you against any claim, liability or loss related to your interest in the Equipment and may be cancelled by us at any time. You agree to pay us an additional amount each month to reimburse us for the insurance premium and an administrative fee, on which we or our affiliates may earn a profit. In the event of loss or damage to the Equipment, you agree to remain responsible for the payment obligations under this Lease until the payment obligations are fully satisfied. 10. You will bear all shipping, de-installing, and crating expenses and will insure the Equipment for its full replacement value during shipping, You must pay additional monthly Payments at the same rate as then in effect under this Lease, until the Equipment is returned by you and is received in good condition and working order by us or our designees. Notwithstanding anything to the contrary set forth in this Lease, the parties acknowledge and agree that we shall have no obligation to remove, delete, preserve, maintain or otherwise safeguard any information, images or content retained by or resident in any Equipment leased by you hereunder, whether through a digital storage device, hard drive or other electronic medium ("Data Management Services"). If desired, you may engage Ricoh to perform Data Management Services at then-prevailing rates. You acknowledge that you are responsible for ensuring your own compliance with legal requirements in connection with data retention and protection and that we do not provide legal advice or represent that the Equipment will guarantee compliance with such requirements. The selection, use and design of any Data Management Services, and any decisions arising with respect to the deletion or storage of data, as well as the loss of any data resulting therefrom, shall be your sole and exclusive responsibility. 11. Lease Payments. Payments will begin on the Equipment delivery and acceptance date ("Effective Date") or such later date as we may designate. The remaining payments are due on the same day of each subsequent month (unless otherwise specified on page 1 hereof). You agree to pay us each payment when it is due, and if any payment is not received within ten (10) days of its due date, you agree to pay a one-time late charge of 5% or $5 (whichever is greater, but not to exceed the maximum amount allowed by applicable law) 12. 13. 14. 15. on the overdue amount. You also agree to pay all shipping and delivery costs associated with the ownership or use of the Equipment, which amounts may be included in your payment or billed separately. You also agree to pay $25 for each check returned for insufficient funds or any other reason. You agree that you will remit payments to us in the form of company checks, (or personal checks in the case of sole proprietorships), direct debit or wires only. You also agree that cash and cash equivalents are not acceptable forms of payment for this Lease and that you will not remit such forms of payment to us. Payment in any other form may delay processing or be returned to you. Furthermore, only you or your authorized agent as approved by us will remit payments to us.
