data.text: SECOND AMENDMENT TO THE MASTER PURCHASE AGREEMENT THIS SECOND AMENDMENT (the “Second Amendment”) to the Master Purchase Agreement is effective as of November 15, 2021 (“Second Amendment Effective Date”) and is entered into by and between R. R. Donnelley & Sons Company (“Provider”), with offices located at 35 West Wacker Drive, Chicago, IL 60601, and Fidelity Information Services, LLC (“FIS”), with offices located at 601 Riverside Avenue, Jacksonville, FL 32204. "Party" or "Parties" means FIS or Provider (as the context indicates) if used in the singular, and both FIS and Provider if used in the plural. WHEREAS, Provider and FIS are parties to that certain Master Purchase Agreement dated October 1, 2017 (the “MPA”), including that certain Commercial Print, Forms and Labels Product and Services Addendum to the Master Purchase Agreement dated October 1,2017, as amended (the “PSA”; the MPA and PSA collectively referred to as the “Agreement”); and WHEREAS, Provider and FIS agree to modify, supplement and or amend the Agreement pursuant to the terms thereof. NOW, THEREFORE, in consideration of the foregoing premises and the mutual covenants and conditions set forth below and for other good and valuable consideration, the receipt and sufficiency of which are hereby acknowledged, Provider and FIS hereby agree as follows: DEFINED TERMS. All of the terms used herein and defined in the Agreement shall have the same meaning as set forth in the Agreement. PART 1. TERM. The first sentence subsection a. of Part 1. Term of the MPA is deleted and replaced with the following sentence. The remainder of subsection a. shall remain as is. “This Agreement shall be effective upon the Effective Date and shall remain in full force and effect thereafter until September 30, 2023 or until all outstanding PSA(s) have expired or been terminated, whichever is later.” EPRODUCT AND SERVICES ADDENDUM - PRINT AND MAIL APPLICATIONS. A new Print and Mail Applications Product and Services Addendum, attached hereto and incorporated into the Agreement by reference, is hereby added to the Agreement. Except as expressly amended, modified and supplemented hereby, the provisions of the Agreement are and shall remain in full force and effect. Each Party acknowledges that it has read this Second Amendment, understands the changes affecting the Agreement and agrees to be bound by the terms of the Agreement as modified hereby as if fully restated herein. The Parties further acknowledge and agree that the Agreement as amended embodies the complete and exclusive statement of the understanding between the Parties and supercedes and merges all related prior proposals and understandings whether oral or written. If any of the terms in this Second Amendment conflict with the terms of the Agreement, this Second Amendment shall control. IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the Parties have executed this Second Amendment as of the Second Amendment Effective Date. FIDELITY INFORMATION SERVICES, LLC By: 11111111111 SSgggggggg  Title: \__N_^m Scaggs  Date: SS^S  R. R. DONNELLEY & SONS COMPANY 01A.BA_ By: Al Dupont (Dec 14, 2021 08:48 PST) Title. Chief Commercial Officer Date: Dec 14,2021  Confidential Page 1 of 5 PRODUCT AND SERVICES ADDENDUM TO MASTER PURCHASE AGREEMENT Print and Mail Applications 1. INCORPORATION OF TERMS. Provider and FIS have entered into that certain Master Purchase Agreement dated October 1, 2017, as amended (the “Master Purchase Agreement”) which sets forth certain terms and conditions applicable to products and services provided from Provider to FIS. The terms and conditions of the Master Purchase Agreement are hereby incorporated into this PSA (defined below) by this reference. If the Parties amend the Master Purchase Agreement to change any of the terms and conditions of the Master Purchase Agreement, the terms and conditions as so amended shall be deemed incorporated into this Product and Service Addendum - Print and Mail Applications (“PSA”). The capitalized terms used but not defined in this PSA shall have the meaning assigned them in the Master Purchase Agreement. 2. PSA INITIAL TERM. This PSA shall be effective upon the Second Amendment Effective Date (“PSA Effective Date”) and shall remain in full force and effect thereafter until September 30, 2023 (the “PSA Initial Term”). Unless either party provides the other party with no less than sixty (60) days advance written notice of its intent to terminate this PSA prior to the end of the PSA Initial Term or any PSA Renewal Term, this PSA shall automatically renew for successive one (1) year terms (each a “PSA Renewal Term”), unless terminated sooner as provided herein. The PSA Initial Term and Renewal Term are referred to collectively as the “PSA Term”. In the event this PSA terminates prior to the expiration or termination of an SOW hereunder, this PSA shall continue to govern such SOW until such time as the SOW expires or is terminated in accordance with the terms and conditions in the Agreement or the SOW. 3. STATEMENTS OF WORK. The requirements for each print and mail application shall be set forth in a (i) Customer purchase order, (ii) job plan, (iii) statement of work, or (iv) other mutually agreed upon document (collectively referred to herein as, the “SOW”). The parties agree that each SOW shall be strictly subject to the terms and conditions of the Master Purchase Agreement and this PSA. RR Donnelley agrees to provide to Customer during the SOW term, and Customer agrees to purchase from RR Donnelley during the SOW term, those Products and Services set forth in a specific SOW. The SOW shall, at a minimum, contain: (i) a term, (ii) the contact names, phone numbers and email addresses for the key personnel of each party, (iii) a detailed description of the Products and Services, (iv) the specifications and requirements for the Products and Services, (v) any applicable service levels, if any, and (vi) pricing for the Products and Services. In the event of a conflict between the pricing, price adjustment or postage terms set forth in this PSA with the pricing, price adjustment or postage terms set forth in the SOW, the pricing, price adjustment or postage terms in the SOW shall control. Statement of Work #1 is attached hereto as Exhibit 1. 4. PRICE ADJUSTMENT. Unless otherwise set forth in the applicable SOW, the pricing set forth in each SOW shall be subject to adjustment based on the following: Materials: The prices for Products may be adjusted for changes in material prices based on the percent price change to RRD as documented by a mill letter (each an “Adjustment Date”). Each paper mill letter will indicate the effective date of the actual price change. Material cost will be deemed to be 50% of the Product’s total price (excluding freight). Services: The prices for Products may be adjusted based on the percent change in the Consumer Price Index for all Urban Consumers (CPI-U) U.S. City Average for All Items published by the Bureau of Labor Statistics for the United States Department of Labor (1982-1984-100) (the “CPI”). “CPI Change” will be measured as the percentage increase from (1) the most recent CPI published value available in the month prior to the adjustment date, and (2) the SOW Effective Date, or the last Adjustment Date, whichever occurred last. Labor cost will be deemed to be 50% of the Product’s total price (excluding freight). Example (Assumed): Current Price is $100 Mill Letter increase is 5% CPI increase is 2% Material % is 50% Labor % is 50% New Price = $100 x ((5% x 50%) + (2% x 50%) + 1) = $103.50 Presort. If a USPS rate change results in an increase to the spread between the 5-digit Automation Letter rate and the ADC Automation Letter rate, then the rate RRD bills to Customer for presort services will be adjusted. This adjustment will be calculated as 60% of the change to the spread. Confidential Page 2 of 5 If a USPS rate change results in a decrease to the spread between the 5-digit Automation Letter rate and the ADC Automation Letter rate, then the rate RRD bills to Customer for presort services will be adjusted. This adjustment will be calculated as 60% of the change to the spread. 5. POSTAGE. Unless otherwise set forth in a SOW, For the payment of postage costs hereunder, Customer shall: (a) Establish and properly fund a Centralized Account Processing System (CAPS) account, or its successor, Enterprise Payment System (“EPS”) account, collectively known as “CAPS/EPS” herein, directly with the United States Postal Service (the “USPS”). Customer acknowledges that postage is not included in the price, and that RR Donnelley has no responsibility or liability whatsoever for Customer’s postage costs. In the event a Customer mailing is delayed by the USPS as a result of insufficient postage in Customer’s CAPS/EPS account, RR Donnelley shall have no liability whatsoever, including, but not limited to, compliance with associated service levels and/or payment of associated service level credits. In the event circumstances arise in which Customer is required to provide postage directly to RR Donnelley for metered mail pieces, damaged mail pieces, or foreign mail pieces, for example, Customer agrees to (a) provide RR Donnelley with a check made payable to the U.S. Postmaster (except in the event of metered mail or live stamps such check shall be made payable to RR Donnelley), or (b) send via wire transfer / ACH to a designated RR Donnelley postage account the required postage no later than ten (10) days prior to the scheduled mail date. All Customer postage shall be deposited by RR Donnelley into a non-interest bearing postage account and credited to Customer’s postage permit. Unless otherwise requested by Customer, any postage surplus shall remain in the RR Donnelley postage account and applied to subsequent Customer mailings. If no subsequent Customer mailings are anticipated by Customer, RR Donnelley shall issue a check to Customer for the surplus postage. In the event of a postage deficiency, RR Donnelley shall immediately notify Customer of such deficiency, and Customer shall make prompt payment to RR Donnelley for the required amount(s). RR Donnelley reserves the right to delay a scheduled mail date, without liability, for insufficient postage. (b) If reasonably requested by RR Donnelley, Customer shall provide RR Donnelley with the proper USPS forms and/or documentation (in an executed format if required), or some other mutually agreed upon form and/or documentation, to confirm and support the USPS documents prepared by RR Donnelley on behalf of Customer in performing the mailing services (e.g., Move Update). 6. CUSTOMER DATA. (a) All production and test data furnished by Customer shall remain the property of Customer, and be submitted in the format established by the parties in the applicable SOW. RR Donnelley shall not be responsible for any data furnished by Customer that is defective, accidentally erased, corrupt or otherwise unusable by Customer as a result of the acts or omissions of Customer or for any costs associated with the acts or omissions of Customer, such as duplicating or recreating images, recreating a photo¬ shoot, reprinting or redistributing material that has been printed or bound using defective data or any similar expenses. RR Donnelley’s liability for data that is defective, accidentally erased, corrupt or otherwise unusable as a result of the acts or omissions of RR Donnelley is limited to restoring same provided such restoration can be reasonably performed by RR Donnelley and Customer provides RR Donnelley with all source data in readable form for such restoration, it being presumed conclusively that any data or Customer content delivered to RR Donnelley has been backed up and retained by Customer. (b) Customer is responsible for submitting correct and complete test and/or production data to RR Donnelley. If Customer fails to provide correct and complete test and/or production data, as the case may be, in accordance with mutually agreed upon time schedules set forth in the applicable SOW, RR Donnelley will reschedule and process Customer’s work as promptly as possible. (c) Any changes to the test and/or production data shall be submitted in a change request/change order document. RR Donnelley shall not be responsible for errors or omissions resulting from the inaccuracy or defect in any Customer supplied test data, production data, technical specification, or other provided materials (unless RR Donnelley directly creates the inaccuracy or defect). Customer will pay RR Donnelley, at its then-current rates, for any processing reruns, or any other additional work, performed by RR Donnelley as a result of Customer submitting improper, incorrect or incomplete data. (d) Within sixty (60) days of a mailing date, unless otherwise agreed by the parties, RR Donnelley shall either (i) return Customer data to the Customer or (ii) permanently purge the applicable Customer data from its systems. 7. CUSTOMER OBLIGATIONS. Customer shall ensure (i) it is in compliance with all laws and regulations applicable to it as a recipient of the Products and Services hereunder, including, but not limited to, the CAN-SPAM Act (15 U.S.C. 7701 et seq.), as may be amended from time to time; and (ii) all Customer supplied lists containing email addresses do not contain any email addresses of individuals who have “opted out” of receiving commercial emails from Customer. Customer will promptly (and in any event no later than the time period required by 15 U.S.C. § 7704(a)(4)) notify RR Donnelley of any individuals that “opt out” of receiving such emails from Customer, and shall correct any impacted data files, mailing lists or the like provided to RR Donnelley. Customer agrees to fully defend, indemnify and hold RR Donnelley harmless against any and all suits, claims, liabilities, damages, costs, expenses, or the like, resulting from Customer’s breach of its obligations this Section 7(a). Confidential Page 3 of 5 Exhibit A To Print and Mail Applications Product Services Addendum Statement of Work #1 RRD & FIS Charlotte System - Statement Output Pricing Matrix Quantity Projection Information: RRD will provide box and ship statement fulfillment services for the FIS Charlotte platform banks. Quantities projections are as follows: Monthly: Up to 100,000 images Quarterly: Up to 600,000 images Year-End: Up to 1,200,000 images Production Frequency: RRD will concatenate input files received during the first four (4) business days of the month and kick off processing of all AFP files as one large production run. RRD will mail complete no later than the twelfth (12th) of the month, provided data is received by above timeframe. Beginning on the 5th business day of the month RRD will process daily runs, with files being available from FIS by 8:00PM EST. Production Pricing: *Variable Imaging or Printing: Files received by 4th business day: High Speed Continuous Full Color: $0.046 @ image, includes 24# blank white paper stock (image = each individual side of an 8 % X 11 sheet) Daily processing beginning on the 5th business day: Short run, cut sheet full variable color: $0.101 image. Includes 24# blank white paper stock (image = each individual side of an 8 % X 11 sheet). Cartons: $2.15 I carton: Includes the carton, the packing, the packaging material, printing & applying the shipping label. A $250 minimum may apply if the quantities for a production run are less than this amount. Optional Services applied as needed: - Manual Pulls: $2.50 per pull - No stapling or 3-hole punching - Electronic Pulls communicated prior to print: $1.25 per pull - Special Handle or Express Courier Packaging: $1.75 per pull - Indexed PDF images returned via SFTP: $5.001 thousand images (Image = each individual side of an 8 % X 11 sheet.) Programming and Composition Rates / Conversion Effort: Based on our teams review of the sample input files the initial set up and conversion effort is 238 hours at $150 I hour. Some additional discovery and analysis may be needed to support bank level reporting requirements. Ongoing change management and programming support, upon approval is $1501 hour. Pricing is subject to adjustment pursuant to Section 4 of the PSA. Postage, Taxes, Courier Delivery Charges: Pricing does not include applicable taxes, postage, commingle or overnight delivery charges. Pricing does include C.A.S.S. certified postal sortation. Mailing costs must be paid by FIS at least ten (10) days prior to mailing date. If FIS's estimated payment exceeds the actual postage used, any excess payment will be applied to subsequent mailing or shipments. If the estimated payments are less than the actual postage used, FIS must promptly send a supplement payment to RR Donnelley for the difference. Postage is a straight pass through for RR Donnelley and our clients receive 100% of the qualifying discounts. Performance Credit Information: • 1 day late = 5% of the portion of the invoiced amount relating to the delayed items Confidential Page 4 of 5 2 days late = 20% of the portion of the invoiced amount relating to the delayed items 3 days late = 50% of the portion of the invoiced amount relating to the delayed items 4 + days late = 100% of portion of the invoiced amount relating to the delayed items Paper costs, taxes and postage are excluded from the above performance credit calculation. RRD shall not be obligated to issue performance credits described above if the delay is caused by (i) a Force Majeure Event pursuant to Part 8.a. Delays of the Agreement, (ii) that resulted from any actions, inactions or delays of Customer or any Customer managed third parties, or (iii) any failure of Customer systems. The performance credit clause and penalties will not take effect until Services commencing on March 1,2022. Confidential Page 5 of 5

data.text: ryan i The following outlines an agreement between Ryan Communication Limited and FIS ("Client") to provide communication support on the PACE Index launch in Australia at the Fintech 2020 event in Sydney on May 25,2016. The below details outline the framework for cooperation, in addition to our Terms and Conditions. Support markets Australia. Deliverables under project Ryan Communication Limited shall provide to Client the following services under the scope of the project agreement: Deliverables Pre-Event Activity ■ Counsel on the Australian media market and what would be required for the launch of the PACE Index at FIS' Fintech 2020 event, including: o Coordination of activity through phone conferences and written communication with Michael Gormley, including calls with the key spokespeople and regional marketing head. o Attendance at the event rehearsal ■ Development of locally appropriate key messages and themes from the PACE Index report, aligned with the global PACE Index messaging. ■ Development of a target media list ■ Inviting select journalists to the event and associated coordination ■ Drafting Australian PACE Index media release ■ Development of a Q&A of likely difficult questions journalists may ask Event Activity ■ Distribution of the PACE Index media release ■ Attendance at the Fintech 2020 event to manage media ■ Development of live Tweets from the event Post-Event Activity ■ Coordinating with reporters who attended the event and those who could not ■ Distribution of a blog produced from the event and subsequent media monitoring and coordination with outlets Professional Fees All deliverables above will fall under a project fee of US$14,000. ryan i 1. Terms of appointment a. The agreement between you, FIS and Ryan Communication Limited ("Ryan"), a company incorporated in Hong Kong, shall commence on 4th May 2016 for the project and end on June 30th. The terms of the agreement are as outlined in this Terms and Conditions for Services Agreement and the Scope of Services Agreement. 2. Agreement with client (as outlined in Scope of Services Agreement) a. Agreement: We agree to cooperate with you fully to ensure that the highest level of corporate communication support is provided to your firm. The scope of cooperation has been outlined in the Scope of Services Agreement. The Scope of Services Agreement and these Terms and Conditions constitute the entire agreement between us and may not be amended unless in writing and signed by both parties. b. The relationship between Ryan and the Client shall be that of independent contractors and this agreement shall not be deemed to establish a joint venture between the parties, and nothing herein contained shall be construed as creating a general partnership or other similar relationship or as authorizing any party to act as general agent, or to enter into any contract or other agreement on behalf of the other Party. 3. Services a. We agree to perform the services outlined in the Scope of Services Agreement. We may subcontract any of the services to our international partners and affiliates. 4. Charges and payments c. Project clients: This project will be charged at US$14,000, as per the agreed budget. d. Administrative fee: An administrative fee of 5% is to be applied. This covers the costs of items including subscriptions to relevant publications, calls and transportation to venues when acting on behalf of the clients. e. Colour photocopying fee: A fee of $5 per A4 page and $10 per A3 page will be charged for all colour photocopying requests. f. External supplier fee: If we engage the services of a third party - on behalf of the client and are required to pay for those services, you will pay the cost of the services, together with a standard industry mark-up of 17.65%. • • • ryan i g. Out-of-pocket expenses: We may also charge separately for any reasonable out-of-pocket expenses. Out-of-pocket expenses require pre-approved in writing from the client before being incurred. 5. Terms of payment a. Late payment interest: We may charge interest at HIBOR plus 1.5% per month on the amount overdue. b. Non-payment: We reserve the right at any time to not provide any Services and retain work and materials in our possession, until all outstanding payments, expenses and charges have been settled in full. c. Currency exchange: The rate of any currency exchange shall not be less than the rate applicable when we have made a payment on your behalf. 6. Liability and Indemnity Ryan agrees, to the fullest extent permitted by law, to indemnify and hold harmless the Client against damages, liabilities and costs arising from the negligent acts of Ryan in the performance of professional services under this Agreement, to the extent that Ryan is responsible for such damages, liabilities and costs on a comparative basis of fault and responsibility between the Consultant and the Client. Ryan shall not be obligated to indemnify the Client for the Client's own negligence. 7. Termination The agreement between the Client and Ryan Financial shall continue thereafter the date of signing until terminated by either party in accordance with herewith. Both parties may terminate the agreement by means of a 30 day prior written notice, in the form of a registered letter to the other party. 8. Confidentiality a. At all times, both during engagement with the Client and after termination, Ryan shall keep in strict confidence and shall not disclose any confidential information relating to the business of the Client or customers to any third parties. This confidentiality clause will remain in force during and following the end to any professional agreement. 9. Choice of law a. Any dispute relating to this contract and the Agreement between “the client” and Ryan will be governed by Hong Kong law and the parties submit to the non-exclusive jurisdiction of the Hong Kong courts. ryan ' i Approval and Confirmation: If the terms correctly set forth our agreement, please confirm this agreement by signing and returning to Ryan the duplicate of this agreement. Client 'Z? Signed: Print Name: Ellyn Raftery Date: 4 May 2016 Date: 11/21/2016 Managing Director, Ryan Communication Limited 13F, Wyndham Place 40-44 Wyndham Street Hong Kong

A mutually viable decision shall be made thereafter. • Service Provider shall report all accidents and injuries promptly to the Client and to any government authorities as may be required by applicable law. • Customer satisfaction report needs to be submitted on monthly basis • Electricity bill collection services viz. Service Provider will be responsible for collecting the bill and submitting to the concerned authority. • Service Provider will send consolidated maintenance reports of the ATM site visits on twice a week. • Service provider will submit cleaning images of the site on daily basis along with the MIS. Reports and images should be based on mobile/other applications having site details with time. SCOPE OF WORK FOR DEEP CLEANING Deep Cleaning is to ensure that: 1. HSK & Cleansing to be provided twice a Day 2. Flooring has to be cleaned with Soap Water/ Phenyl. 3. Dustbin is available at the site and cleared & cleaned properly 4. Glass Door and Side Glaze is cleaned with Colin properly 5. Dusting has to be carried out on all equipment/ fixtures available at the site. 6. Glass Door does not have any gum marks/ torn stickers are removed and cleaned properly 7. Site walls, corners, frames, posters are cleaned and are dust free. 8. Spots on the sun mica wall panel of the site is cleaned 9. Room Freshener (cake) is replaced with new one. 10. Cleaning materials kept at the site are not visible to the customer. 11. Air conditioner and the passage for back room is dust free and cleaned properly 12. Dusting is carried out under the foot mat (if available at the site) 13. Backroom is properly cleaned. VASUDEVAN SRIDHAR 14. No dust on batteries & UPS, VSS, VSAT etc. and are cleaned properly. 15. Glaze Tiles alongside of the glass panel of entrance to the ATM is cleaned 16. Ensure all lights inside and outside the site is cleaned properly. 17. ATM top & side body is being cleaned with Colin 18. Glow Sign Board / Fascia is cleaned properly 19. Ceiling/ Ground Tiles and Sun Mica wall panel of the ATM Site is cleaned 20. Writing Ledge is cleaned. SCHEDULE - B Penalty against the deficiency in the service Category Penalty

AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA Date: AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA SCHEDULE - A SCOPE OF WORK - House Keeping • All the cleaning related logbooks, checklists, visitors register prescribed by the Client would have to be properly and duly filled / kept at the site. • Cleaning at the premises twice a day (between 6AM to 11PM) • Service Providers should ensure cleaners are available on all 7 days • Cleaners should have all the Supervisor/ Manager no. to contact if any emergency. • Cleaner's belongings should not be kept inside the lobby of ATM and should be kept in back room. • All the Cleaners deployed at the Premises by Service Provider should be necessarily trained. • In order to maintain a suitable working environment for the Property and Equipment, proper measures shall be taken by Service Provider to see that the same is at all times protected against dust, physical damage, fire, accident, misuse, incorrect use, negligence, abuse, alteration and contamination by maintaining high standards of sanitation practices, personal hygiene and appropriate tools and tackles. • A joint inquiry will be made, to ascertain the loss that may be occasioned to the Client and to determine the reason for such lapses that caused the said loss. A mutually viable decision shall be made thereafter. • Service Provider shall report all accidents and injuries promptly to the Client and to any government authorities as may be required by applicable law. • Service Provider will send consolidated maintenance reports of the ATM site visits in a week. • Service provider will submit cleaning images of the site on daily basis along with the MIS. Reports and images should be based on mobile/other applications having site details with time. SCOPE OF WORK FOR DEEP CLEANING Deep Cleaning is to ensure that: 1. HSK & Cleansing to be provided twice a Day 2. Flooring has to be cleaned with Soap Water/ Phenyl. 3. Dustbin is available at the site and cleared & cleaned properly 4. Glass Door and Side Glaze is cleaned with Colin properly 5. Dusting has to be carried out on all equipment/ fixtures available at the site. 6. Glass Door does not have any gum marks/ torn stickers are removed and cleaned properly 7. Site walls, corners, frames, posters are cleaned and are dust free. 8. Spots on the sun mica wall panel of the site is cleaned 9. Room Freshener (cake) is replaced with new one. 10. Cleaning materials kept at the site are not visible to the customer. 11. Air conditioner and the passage for back room is dust free and cleaned properly 12. Dusting is carried out under the foot mat (if available at the site) 13. Backroom is properly cleaned. 14. No dust on batteries & UPS, VSS, VSAT etc. and are cleaned properly. 15. Glaze Tiles alongside of the glass panel of entrance to the ATM is cleaned 16. Ensure all lights inside and outside the site is cleaned properly. 17. ATM top & side body is being cleaned with Colin 18. Glow Sign Board / Fascia is cleaned properly 19. Ceiling/ Ground Tiles and Sun Mica wall panel of the ATM Site is cleaned 20. Writing Ledge is cleaned. value.text: 14. TERM 14.1 The Certification Contract terminates in its entirety upon the earlier occurrence of any of the following cases: (i) for the term named in the one-time Certification Contracts, after expiration of a contractual term of three years after successful initial integration certification, or after not successfully passing the certification tests within the nine months period as set forth under § 6 (5), (ii) in case of Certification Contracts with an annual subscription, this Certification Contract comes into effect with its execution and shall be in effect for an initial 12-month term following contract execution ("Initial Term”). Thereafter it shall automatically renew for subsequent twelve (12) month terms ("Renewal Term”) unless terminated with sixty (60) days written notice before the end of the current term.

12. LIMITATION OF LIABILITY 12.1 EXCEPT FOR THE OBLIGATIONS UNDER SECTIONS 11.3 AND 11.4 AND BREACHES OF CONFIDENTIAL INFORMATION, AND ANYTHING TO THE CONTRARY HEREIN NOTWITH¬STANDING, WHETHER IN CONTRACT, TORT, OR OTHERWISE, UNDER NO CIRCUMSTANCES SHALL SAP OR ITS LICENSORS OR VENDOR BE LIABLE TO THE OTHER PARTY OR ANY OF THEIR REPRESENTATIVES FOR AN AMOUNT OF DAMAGES IN EXCESS OF THE PAID SERVICE FEES SET FORTH IN THE CONTRACT, OR BE LIABLE IN ANY AMOUNT FOR SPECIAL, INCIDENTAL, CONSEQUENTIAL, OR INDIRECT DAMAGES, LOSS OF GOOD WILL OR BUSINESS PROFITS, WORK STOPPAGE, DATA LOSS, COMPUTER FAILURE OR MALFUNCTION, ANY AND ALL OTHER COMMERCIAL DAMAGES OR LOSS, OR EXEMPLARY OR PUNITIVE DAMAGES, EVEN IF THE PARTY HAS BEEN ADVISED OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGES. EACH PARTY'S LIABILITY IS CUMULATIVE; WITH ALL OF THE CLAIMING PARTY'S LOSSES BEING AGGREGATED TO DETERMINE SATISFACTION OF THE LIMIT. The provisions of the Certification Contract allocate risks between SAP and Vendor. The service fees reflect the allocation of risk and the limitations of liability herein.
Payments are due net thirty (30) day from the receipt of the applicable invoice.

14.5 In case of termination of the Certification Contract: (a) each party shall promptly return to the other party all advertising materials and other property, including all Confidential Information, provided by the other party subject to the Certification Contract or, as specifically agreed, destroy such information. The Return or destruction shall be certified in writing

14.2 SAP or Vendor may terminate the Certification Contract in its entirety immediately for cause in the event of a material breach of any provision of the respective Certification Contract that is not cured within thirty (30) days after the terminating party provides notice of such breach in writing. 14.3 Termination for cause by either party shall also apply in the following cases: (i) if either party becomes insolvent, insolvency proceedings have justifiably been applied for on the Party's assets, such application has been rejected for lack of assets, execution measures against the SAP Integration Certification Center Software General
14.2 SAP or Vendor may terminate the Certification Contract in its entirety immediately for cause in the event of a material breach of any

value.text: 15.5 Neither party shall transfer, assign, or sublicense its rights or obligations under the Certification Contract in whole or in part, without the prior written consent of the other party. SAP may assign the Certification Contract in whole or in part to an affiliate. In case of any change of control with Vendor, Vendor agrees to provide SAP with written notice upon the signing the definitive acquisition agreements or the public announcement and SAP has the right to terminate this Certification Contract or consent to the assignment within thirty (30) days of receipt of such notice. § 14 subparagraphs 5 and 6 shall apply accordingly.

DocuSign Envelope ID: 90571DB5-F469-4564-8334-44E83A03D517 SAP General Terms and Conditions for Software Certification from SAP Integration and Certification Center ("ICC”) - US Law 1. SCOPE 1.1 These General Terms and Conditions ("GTCs”) shall apply exclusively to all Service Offers under which SAP SE (herein "SAP”) provides any service through the SAP Integration and Certification Center to a software vendor, whose software solutions runs or integrates with SAP Software (herein: "Vendor”). These GTCs apply to all of the Software Integration Scenarios listed at http://www.sap.com/icc. 1.2 These GTCs, and any applicable executed Service Offer, represent the sole and exclusive understanding of the Parties. No conflicting or other provision, including but not limited to any general terms and conditions of Vendor, shall become part of the Certification Contract, even if such conditions are appended to a Vendor's order and SAP performs the order without expressly rejecting such conditions. 2. DEFINITIONS 2.1 Confidential Information means information that is disclosed or otherwise obtained under the Certification Contract, provided that the information is marked as confidential. Confidential Information may be in any tangible form including hardcopy, electronic mail, schematics or other work. Information that is transmitted orally shall be treated as Confidential Information after the receipt of written notice to that effect from the disclosing party, provided that such notice is received within thirty (30) days of such oral disclosure. In addition, SAP Software, information contained in the SAP system of SAP including know-how, business models, processes, techniques and concepts, information on customers and partners, information on any third-party software used, flow charts, documentations and product specifications, as well as the conditions of the Service Offer and all agreements relating thereto, are understood to constitute Confidential Information of SAP without regard to the marking requirements above. 2.2 Vendor Solution means Vendor's software solution as well as Vendor's products that are named in the Service Offer and that is able to operate and to integrate with the SAP Software in compliance with the SAP integration criteria and in accordance with the current Certification Guide, and/or the appropriate SAP Documentation. 2.3 Intellectual Property Rights means patents of any type, design rights, utility models or other similar invention rights, copyrights, mask work rights, trade secret or confidentiality rights, know-how, and any other intangible property rights including applications for any of the foregoing, in any country, arising under statutory or common law or by contract and whether or not perfected, now existing or hereafter filed, issued, or acquired. 2.4 Integration Scenario means the relevant scenarios and specifications for a particular certification, as described in more detail in the Service Offer and in the applicable Certification Guide and/or the provided SAP documentation. 2.5 SAP Sample Code means the proprietary sample code provided to Vendor during the course of the Certification Contract solely for studying and testing purposes. 2.6 Service Offer means an offer from SAP to Vendor for certification services through the SAP ICC. 2.7 SAP Interface means an/a SAP Software interface(s) released by SAP for certification purposes that allow data access or exchange between the Vendor Solution and the SAP Software via the Vendor's interface. SAP Integration Certification Center Software General Terms and Conditions enGLOBAL.v.5-2019 Page 1 of 14 DocuSign Envelope ID: 90571DB5-F469-4564-8334-44E83A03D517 2.8 SAP Software means the proprietary SAP solution expressly named in the Service Offer. The SAP Software also includes the SAP interfaces, the structure, sequence, and organization of the SAP software. 2.9 Certification Contract means the combination of these GTCs and any applicable Service Offer executed pursuant thereto between SAP and a given Vendor. 2.10 Certification Guide shall mean the SAP Integration Guide - Technologies for the applicable software integration certification as listed on the SCN ICC page at http://www.sap.com/icc. 2.11 Affiliate means a legal entity located in the Territory that now, or in the future, directly or indirectly, is controlled with or by, or is under common control with, the Vendor. For purposes of the foregoing, "control" is defined as the ownership of fifty percent (50%) or more of the equity or beneficial interest of such legal entity or for purposes of foreign corporations, if less than fifty percent (50%), the maximum amount allowed by applicable law. Any such entity shall be considered an Affiliate for only such time as Vendor continues to own such equity interest. 3. CONTRACTUAL OBLIGATIONS; LIMITED TIME FOR PERFORMANCE 3.1 These GTCs shall also apply to any certification relationships between SAP and Vendor prior to execution of a Service Offer. All items provided by SAP to Vendor before execution of the Service Offer (examples: proposals, test programs, designs) are the property of SAP (see § 8) and must not be copied or made accessible to third parties except as permitted under these GTCs. If no Service Offer is executed, they must be returned or deleted, and Vendor must, not later than the time the parties fail to conclude a Service Offer, cease and desist from using them. 3.2 The certification offered under the Service Offer does not refer to the quality of the Vendor Solution. The certification refers only to the respective Integration Scenario and to the verification of the compliance of the Vendor Solution with the Integration Scenario. 3.3 Except as otherwise provided in the Service Offer, Vendor may send a notice of acceptance within the Validity of Offer date stated in the Service Offer. 3.4 The execution of the Certification Contract, as well as any subsequent amendment, supplement notice of default, or deadline notices or termination notices are only valid if made in writing. The foregoing provision also applies to any waiver of the written-form requirement. 3.5 The requirement of a written form in § 3 subparagraph 4 (or elsewhere in the Certification Contract) requires at least scanned signed copies emailed between the parties, or exchange of letters, or as otherwise expressly agreed in the Certification Contract. 3.6 Signatures sent by electronic means (facsimile, scanned and sent via e-mail, or signed by electronic signature service where legally permitted) shall be deemed original signatures. 4. PROVISION OF WORKS AND SERVICES 4.1 The Certification Contract defines the scope of the works and services. SAP is responsible for (i) providing to Vendor the appropriate documentation specific to the Integration Scenario and/or the relevant test plan / Certification Guide and (ii) if applicable providing the relevant SAP Sample Code, or hosted shared test environment for testing, only where technically feasible as confirmed by SAP ICC consultants and (iii) issuing an "integration certificate" in electronic format (PDF) for Vendor after successful conclusion of the integration certification process, provided Vendor has fulfilled the terms of the Certification Contract . 4.2 Vendor acknowledges that for specific integration scenarios as defined in Annex 2, Vendor must adhere to the special conditions and prerequisites described therein. The integration certificate is valid worldwide for the duration indicated on the integration certificate. 4.3 SAP will decide which employees to use and reserves the right to replace any employee at any time. SAP may use contractors or third parties to perform its duties in the Certification Contract SAP Integration Certification Center Software General Terms and Conditions enGLOBAL.v.5-2019 Page 2 of 14 DocuSign Envelope ID: 90571DB5-F469-4564-8334-44E83A03D517 as long as they are subject to confidentiality obligations. SAP shall be responsible for the actions of any contractors and third parties used by SAP under this Certification Contract. 4.4 Any trial or evaluation use of the SAP Software shall be provided pursuant to a separate SAP Trial Agreement to be entered into between the parties separate from the Certification Contract. 5. VENDOR'S CONTRIBUTIONS 5.1 In all phases and for all actions under this Certification Contract, a reasonable cooperation of Vendor is required. Vendor must provide free of charge all reasonable contributions as required in connection with performance of its obligations under the Certification Contract, including but not limited to providing necessary personnel, workspace, hardware, software, data, and telecommunications facilities, answering questions, and evaluating SAP's deliverables. To the extent required for performance under the Certification Contract, Vendor shall grant SAP direct and remote access to Vendor's hardware and software. 5.2 Vendor must nominate in writing a suitable contact person for SAP (and qualified subproject leads, if beneficial for the collaboration), and provide SAP with the contact data (including but not limited to an e-mail address and telephone number) at which SAP can reach each such person or an authorized substitute at all times. The contact person must be in a position to make necessary decisions for Vendor or ensure that they are made without delay. Vendor must inform SAP of all changes to the contact details in writing without delay. 5.3 Vendor is responsible for adapting the Vendor Solution in accordance with the technical and functional requirements of the Integration Scenario and the underlying specific SAP documentation. Vendor must provide all information reasonably requested by SAP concerning the Vendor Solution and its technical usage scenario in connection with SAP Software and the corresponding SAP Interface. 5.4 SAP will determine the place and mode of the certification testing, which may be provided either by tests using Internet collaboration tools or on-site. Vendor shall ensure at its own expense that the Vendor Solution as well as all software, documentation, resources, and/or materials required for integration certification testing from Vendor are ready and accessible. Alternatively to conducting the certification testing at SAP's facilities, the test may be conducted at a location specified by the Vendor, if agreed to in advance by SAP in writing. In such a case, Vendor shall pay for all travel and subsistence costs and expenses for the SAP personnel involved. In case hardware and software of Vendor is shipped to SAP tests, it is the responsibility of the Vendor to remove the hardware from SAP at the certification location after certification. SAP will not be responsible for shipment and return of the hardware or the associated costs. 5.5 Certification services are not provided for custom-tailored or individual solutions, but only for standard solutions generally available in the market. Upon SAP's request, Vendor will provide evidence that the Vendor Solution is a generally available product and not a custom-tailored solution or developed for a specific customer. 5.6 Vendor must promptly notify SAP of any change in the circumstances on which the Certification Contract or the certification services are based on, including but not limited to the fact that (i) the Vendor Solution is no longer generally available or (ii) the Vendor Solution is technically modified (in a way that impacts the Integration Scenario), or (iii) the name of Vendor or of the Vendor Solution is changed, or (iv) change of any software component and/or configuration of the Vendor Solution. In such cases the Vendor Solution may either be no longer eligible for certification or has to be re-certified according to § 7. 5.7 With the successful certification as described under § 6, Vendor hereby consents, that SAP may include Vendor's name, address and company logo, as well as information provided by the Vendor relating to the tested Vendor Solution in a reference list on the respective SAP Web site, as well as in collateral and advertising material relating to integration certification. All use of Vendor's name will be in accordance with Vendor's published TM guidelines provided by Vendor directly to SAP at the time of certification. SAP may change the contents or restructure SAP Integration Certification Center Software General Terms and Conditions enGLOBAL.v.5-2019 Page 3 of 14 DocuSign Envelope ID: 90571DB5-F469-4564-8334-44E83A03D517 its Web site in its sole discretion, including but not limited to the materials on integration certification. In addition, SAP may provide any of its licensees and prospective customers that requests information about the Vendor Solution with the information provided by Vendor (for example, product description and contact details) for that purpose. Vendor may revoke SAP's right to use Vendor's data as provided under this subsection 7 upon thirty (30) days prior written notice. In this case, SAP is entitled to terminate the Certification Contract with immediate effect. 5.8 Vendor must bear all costs and expenses arising out of its breach of its collaborative obligations under this § 5 or elsewhere in the Certification Contract. Vendor is obligated to pay any agreed upon fees in case of SAP's non-performance pursuant to Vendor's failure to perform or properly perform its obligations under the Certification Contract. 6. INTEGRATION CERTIFICATION 6.1 The Integration Scenario applicable to the certification is described in the Certification Contract. The successfully concluded Integration certification implies that the Vendor Solution meets the specifications defined in the documentation of the Integration Scenario and has been successfully tested by SAP against them. SAP's technical integration certification however does not guarantee fault-free operation of the Vendor Solution nor may Vendor make any statement whatsoever with respect to any connection of the legal compliance of the Vendor Solution with the integration certification provided hereunder. Vendor must not make any representation or declaration in that regard. The payment of the Estimated Service Fees under the applicable Service Offer does not guarantee the successful granting of the Certification of the Vendor Solution. 6.2 SAP reserves the right to determine the sequence of integration certification in the case of multiple applications of different vendors. 6.3 Upon Vendor's successful completion of the certification, during the term of the Certification Contract, SAP will issue an acknowledgement in electronic format to Vendor in the form of an SAP integration certificate. The integration certificate is valid worldwide and may be used for marketing as such also by Vendor's Affiliates, subject to Vendor ensuring the proper use of the integration certificate according to these GTCs by the Affiliate. SAP grants Vendor the right to use the integration certificate and the statement contained therein solely for the version of the Vendor Solution stated in the integration certificate in relation to the specially certified Integration Scenario and solely in connection with the special version of the SAP Software for advertising and promotion purposes. The entitlement to use a specific integration certificate expires after the term stated on the certificate itself, or when any of the tested software components are no longer in maintenance by Vendor. Vendor may then no longer use the integration certificate in its communication with its clients or other third parties. The SAP tagline or SAP logo(s) described in the Certification Contract are to be used in accordance with Annex 1 to these GTCs and SAP's then current trademark license terms and any of the respective usage guidelines. SAP is entitled to terminate the Certification Contract with immediate effect if Vendor breaches this § 6 (3). 6.4 Without prior written consent from SAP, Vendor is not permitted to render or provide any information concerning SAP software license terms, SAP Software, SAP Interface or any other information related to SAP products, except as expressly stated in the Certification Contract. Vendor shall refer any customer requiring such information to SAP. Vendor agrees to obtain SAP's prior written consent of all statements regarding SAP itself, SAP software and SAP services in conjunction with the subject matter of the Certification Contract. Vendor is entitled to repeat its use of a statement after such statement has been initially approved by SAP. However, if the content of such an approved statement remains no longer true because of major changes, SAP may withdraw its approval. 6.5 Unless otherwise stated in the Certification Contract, Vendor must complete the integration certification process for the Vendor Solution within nine (9) months after effective date of the SAP Integration Certification Center Software General Terms and Conditions enGLOBAL.v.5-2019 Page 4 of 14 DocuSign Envelope ID: 90571DB5-F469-4564-8334-44E83A03D517 Certification Contract, and in case of annual subscriptions within each subsequent Renewal Term. If Vendor fails to do so, the integration certification fee shall not be refunded. 7. RE-CERTIFICATION 7.1 Vendor is entitled to use the integration certificate as well as the logo(s) and other rights granted in the Certification Contract only in connection with the version of the Vendor Solution tested during the integration certification process and the particular version of the SAP Interface and Integration Scenario respectively. To use the certification statement with further versions, a new integration certification process ("Re-certification") is required. In the following cases, Vendor must trigger a Re-certification to continue using the certification statement and other rights granted in the Certification Contract for an existing already certified Vendor Solution: (a) Modifications of the SAP Interface or change to a SAP Interface version (b) Modifications or enhancements to the tested Vendor Solution that affect the Integration Scenario and/or impede an exchange of data with the SAP Interface (c) Modifications of any software component and/or configuration as tested (d) Change of the name or the labeling of the Vendor Solution (e) Change to Vendor's company name (f) Expiration of the validity indicated on the integration certificate. 7.2 SAP will use commercially reasonable efforts to give notification of any modification to SAP Software affecting the Integration Scenario within a reasonable period soon after it is generally released to SAP customers, and to provide to Vendor the relevant documentation for any release changes of the SAP Software related to the Integration Scenario by the release date. 7.3 There is no obligation on the part of SAP to offer a Re-certification for any particular Integration Scenario. SAP provides consulting and certification test services for such a Re-certification at SAP's then current terms and conditions. Integration Scenario is based upon the SAP Integration Scenario Payment Card Interface 1.0 for SAP S/4HANA (S/4- CA-PCI 1.0) 2. Period of Services. All Services provided by SAP under this Service Offer are estimated to be completed by the end of the Number of Work Days included. Vendor must complete the Integration Certification process for the Vendor Interface Software pursuant to Section 14(1) of the GTCs. If Vendor fails to do so, SAP reserves the right to terminate this Service Offer, in which case the Service Fees shall not be refunded. 3. Work and Fees. For the stated Service Fee, SAP will provide the respective personnel necessary for the stated Work Days of Integration Certification test services. Each Work Day is for eight (8) hours per Work Day. In the event the Work Days are exceeded, SAP will charge Vendor at its then current consulting rates for any additional effort required for the Integration Certification testing. Necessary or agreed upon travel and subsistence expenses will also be charged on Vendor’s account. Vendor understands that the calculation of taxes may be affected by this service location. Payment of the Service Fee specified in this Service Offer is due upon signature and will be invoiced by SAP according to the GTCs. 4. Validity of Offer. The validity of this offer will expire thirty (30) days from the Effective Date above unless sooner executed by Vendor and SAP, or extended in writing by SAP. 5. General. Any earlier Service Offer(s) submitted by SAP concerning the same scope of services become hereby null and void. In case any services are provided before execution of this Service Offer, the terms and conditions of this Service Offer and the GTCs shall apply accordingly, including all terms on remuneration. Signatures sent by electronic means (facsimile, scanned and sent via e-mail, or signed by electronic signature service where legally permitted) shall be deemed original signatures. data.text: DocuSign Envelope ID: FEDA29D4-5BFF-4801-8233-F69C370AFAFB Variation 1 to the Statement of Works between Worldpay UK Ltd and bartlett mitchell Limited (together the "Parties") Worldpay UK Ltd ("Worldpay") and bartlett mitchell limited ("BM"), entered into an Agreement for the Supply of Services at its premises The Walbrook Building, 25 Walbrook, London EC4N 8AF commencing on 1st January 2019, the "Statement of Works" or the "SOW". The Parties wish to vary the SOW and agree the immediate variation to the terms and conditions therein as follows: Clause 2.1 of the SOW shall be amended to read: 2.1 This Statement of Work shall commence on 1st January 2019 and, unless terminated earlier in accordance with its terms, shall continue until 30th November 2022, (the "Term"). Clause 8 of the SOW shall be amended to read: 8.1 The Charges for the Services shall be payable in pounds sterling. Assumptions applicable to this proposal The accounts are traded as different entities. Cafe, Free Issues & Hospitality and will be reported as separate trading accounts. a) Labour is fixed as per the budget, and any variations much be agreed in writing, with Worldpay. Additional labour for hospitality and functions may be required and if this is the case, then this will be charged as part of the event charge b) Meal entitlement for agreed Suppliers employees will apply and will be recharged on a monthly basis shown on the invoice under operational costs c) The operation will operate on a cost plus for all other lines with the invoice value being dependent on sales. No guarantees are offered on sales. WP London Phased Budget 2020 RS2611' A summary of the annual costs for budget year 2020 is included at Appendix 1. On a quarterly basis the Supplier and Worldpay will reconcile Operational and Variable Costs where a shoring up process will take place between the Supplier and Worldpay. For the purpose of calculating the incentive bonus (monthly and annually), refer to the table below. DocuSign Envelope ID: FEDA29D4-5BFF-4801-8233-F69C370AFAFB Charges for the Services in the first budget year January 2020 to December 2020 shall be: Monthly cost Operational Cost Variable Costs   Hospitality Free Issue (Tea, Coffee & Coffee Beans, Milk etc) Jan 16,662 13,035 10,734 Feb 14,489 11,335 9,334 March 14,489 11,335 9,334 April 13,040 10,201 8,400 May 16,662 13,035 10,734 June 14,489 11,335 9,334 July 18,111 14,169 11,667 Aug 14,489 11,335 9,334 Sep 13,764 10,768 8,867 Oct 14,489 11,335 9,334 Nov 18,111 14,169 11,667 Dec 13,764 10,768 8,867 Total for year 182,557 142,820 117,602 8.2 Each month the Supplier will invoice Worldpay providing a breakdown of charges showing, Operational Costs, Hospitality, Free Issue. 8.3 The supplier has the opportunity to earn a incentive bonus of £40,000 between January 2020 and December 2020. £1,000 bonus will be payable by Worldpay to the supplier if the supplier costs are below the agreed target Operating Costs per month (row 37 of the embedded 'London phase' spreadsheet) and an additional £1,000 bonus if the free issue costs are below the agreed target Free Issue costs per month (row 43 in the embedded spreadsheet). If at 31st December 2020 the supplier is either within the total operational cost price for the year or below, (£182,557 for operating cost and £117,602 for free issue) Worldpay will pay the supplier the remainder of £40,000 (less the bonus amount already paid). 8.4 Expenses are not chargeable under this Schedule of Work. The remaining terms and conditions of the Catering Agreement referred to above shall continue in force, save as to any changes, addenda or variations which have previously been agreed in writing in accordance with those terms and conditions. value.text: This Schedule shall come into effect as on 01st January 2022 (“Effective Date”) and shall remain in full force through 31st December 2022 (“Term”), unless terminated earlier pursuant to the Master Agreement. The Term of this Schedule may be extended by mutual written agreement of the parties hereto.

SLA: Per link required is 99.5% monthly for State capital and metro. 99% monthly for remaining locations. Uptime will be measured and reported on a monthly basis. Uptime includes the last mile as well. Uptime/Downtime report to be published by 11th of the month for preceding month Penalty: penalty of .5 % of the MRC for every .5% drop in committed uptime target subject to a maximum of 8% of MRC for SLA violation. If Downtime persists FIS can cancel the link and place the order on any other service provider. Penalties will be effective for monthly basis reconciled over a quarterly billing period. Penalty for delayed delivery: Beyond Delivery Timeline, Vendor is liable to pay a penalty of .5% of the ARC per week's delay for that site- subject to a maximum of 8% of ARC for that site.

data.text: DocuSign Envelope ID: 9DF7D615-A615-48B7-8714-E511A0807CDE Schedule Number: 10 to Master Services Agreement This Schedule Number: 10 ("Schedule") is made on this 01th day of January, 2022; entered into by and between FIS Payment Solutions & Services India Private Limited, a Company incorporated under the Companies Act, 1956, having its registered office address at S-405(LGF), Greater Kailash Part II, New Delhi-110048 and its Corporate office at 3rd floor, Fairmont, Hiranandani Business Park, Powai, Mumbai 400 076 and Bharti Airtel Ltd. a Company incorporated under the Companies Act, 1956, having its registered office address at Bharti Crescent, 1, Vasant Kunj, Phase II, Nelson Mandela Road, New Delhi. ("Service Provider"). WHEREAS: A. The Parties have entered into a Master Services Agreement for Telecommunication Services dated 03rd day of February 2016 (the "Master Agreement"). This Schedule is the entered between the parties pursuant to Master Agreement and shall be considered as the integral part of the Master Agreement. B. The terms and conditions of the Master Agreement are incorporated, by reference, into this Schedule. C. FIS wishes to engage the Service Provider for provision of Services like MPLS Connectivity and the Service Provider is willing to enter into such engagement with FIS. NOW, THEREFORE, in consideration of the mutual promises and covenants contained herein the parties agree as follows: 1. Scope of Service Provider's Services and Service Level Terms Service Provider shall perform the Services as specified under Annexure A Service provider acknowledges that the Services that FIS is procuring under this Schedule are very critical to the business of FIS and affairs of its customers. Hence, Service Provider further acknowledges and agrees that it will take every effort to ensure that the Services are provided without interruption or degradation below the Service Levels and that it will have limited rights to terminate or in any way limit the provision of any or all of the Services during the Term of this Schedule including any extensions thereto. 2. Term DocuSign Envelope ID: 9DF7D615-A615-48B7-8714-E511A0807CDE This Schedule shall come into effect as on 01st January 2022 (“Effective Date”) and shall remain in full force through 31st December 2022 (“Term”), unless terminated earlier pursuant to the Master Agreement. The Term of this Schedule may be extended by mutual written agreement of the parties hereto. 3. Fees The fees shall be as per the rate card mentioned in Annexure A. 4. Payment Terms and Conditions The Payment Terms and Conditions shall be as per the LOA shared by SAKON. 5. Additional Points, Other Terms & Conditions. I. Service Provider should connect all the branches through agreed media like Fiber, Copper, RF-P2P, P2MP, internet wired broadband and VSAT. 2. Hand off will be Ethernet in all the branches and DC/DRC. All the services must be extended up to router/CPE in all the branches and DC/DR backed by SLAs. 3. Support Escalation matrix of respective regions and for PAN INDIA as well, must be shared with FIS and updated in every quarter irrespective of any changes 4. Feasibility Confirmation: Feasibility report on L2 level needs to be shared within 7 working days of receipt of instructions from FIS 5. Link delivery timelines: Copper/Fiber-On Net locations:4-6 weeks, RF: 4-6 weeks, VSAT: 4-6weeks,4G:4-6 weeks. 6. Confirmation of order login in vendor's system & link delivery schedule should come within 7 days after release of Delivery Order else FIS has right to cancel the link. 7. Latency: Latency should be as per the following: Average accepted latency will be between 90-120ms for branch to DC connectivity. Metro and State Capital latency: 100ms and Rest all locations: 120ms from Branch to DC/DR. Packet loss : <= 1% from DC/DR to branch. Acceptable for Tier1 ,Tier 2 for Tier 3 <= 120ms applicable for RF, Copper, Fiber and 4G links 8. Performance of the entire network will be reviewed every month with FIS along with the supporting documents which includes but not limited to MIS reports, Downtime / Uptime Reports, Incident / RCA reports related to our circuits. 9. Obtaining any and all permissions with relation to the links to be provisioned for this project will be sole responsibility of the Service Provider, except the Branch site / premises. 10. All outages at any locations need to be escalated to FIS promptly followed by a detailed Incident Report (within 24 hours) and RCA report post resolution (within 2-3 days). Automated alerts and tickets to be raised for any outages including last mile and provide the credit for those outages II. Dedicated Project Manager from Service Provider should be provided for duration of the delivery period. Delivery Tracker to be maintained by the Project Manager and has to publish twice in a week with updated delivery status & dates. 12. Cancellation: FIS can cancel the link for non-performance or any other reason with 30 days notice period and suitable reimbursement to be made to FIS in case of any advance payment made for any engagement DocuSign Envelope ID: 9DF7D615-A615-48B7-8714-E511A0807CDE 13. Antenna / pole need to dismantle and taken back by ISP along with other devices when any link is disconnected by FIS SLA: Per link required is 99.5% monthly for State capital and metro. 99% monthly for remaining locations. Uptime will be measured and reported on a monthly basis. Uptime includes the last mile as well. Uptime/Downtime report to be published by 11th of the month for preceding month Penalty: penalty of .5 % of the MRC for every .5% drop in committed uptime target subject to a maximum of 8% of MRC for SLA violation. If Downtime persists FIS can cancel the link and place the order on any other service provider. Penalties will be effective for monthly basis reconciled over a quarterly billing period. Penalty for delayed delivery: Beyond Delivery Timeline, Vendor is liable to pay a penalty of .5% of the ARC per week's delay for that site- subject to a maximum of 8% of ARC for that site. For any delay beyond that period, FIS can cancel the link and place the order on any other service provider. Rate Card shared will be applicable to all the links which is procured by FIS. IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the parties have caused this Schedule to be executed as of the dates as indicated below. FIS Payment Solutions & Services India Private  M/s. Bharti Airtel Ltd. TERM 2.1 The Agreement shall commence on the Effective Date and shall continue for a period of one (1) year (Initial Term) which shall automatically renew at the end of the Initial Term for a further one (1) year period. Automatic renewal will continue each year thereafter unless 6 months' prior notice is given to terminate the Agreement by Worldpay. This 6 months' notice may be given at anytime.

13. TERMINATION 13.1 Worldpay may (without prejudice to its other rights or remedies) terminate this Agreement and/or an SOW with immediate effect by written notice to the Supplier if: (a) the Supplier commits a material breach of this Agreement or an SOW that is not remediable or, if remediable, is not remedied within thirty (30) days after being given notice to do so; (b) the Supplier commits repeated or persistent breaches of the same or similar provisions of this Agreement and/or any SOW (as applicable) which by their repetition become material and it has been given notice on at least 3 prior occasions in the preceding 6 months that it is in breach and warned that further breaches may result in termination of this Agreement; (c) a Force Majeure Event persists for more than thirty (30) consecutive Business Days; (d) an Insolvency Event occurs in relation to the Supplier; or (e) a change of Control occurs in relation to the Supplier where the Supplier is unable to demonstrate to Worldpay's reasonable satisfaction that such third party is an economic entity of reasonable financial standing and that such change of Control does not increase the risk or cost to Worldpay in respect of the Services. 13.2 The Supplier may terminate this Agreement and/or any relevant SOW immediately by notice in writing if Worldpay has failed to pay in full any undisputed amounts contained in an invoice from the Supplier within ninety (90) days of the due date of payment of such invoice provided that at least one written reminder notice has been delivered to Worldpay at least twenty- one (21) days prior to any such termination.

13.3 Either Party may terminate this Agreement for convenience upon 6 months' written notice to the other Party subject to (a) and (b) below. In addition the Parties may terminate this Agreement by mutual written agreement at any time.

Worldpay may (without prejudice to its other rights or remedies) terminate this Agreement and/or an SOW with immediate effect by written notice to the Supplier if: (a) the Supplier commits a material breach of this Agreement or an SOW that is not remediable or, if remediable, is not remedied within thirty (30) days after being given notice to do so; (b) the Supplier commits repeated or persistent breaches of the same or similar provisions of this Agreement and/or any SOW (as applicable) which by their repetition become material and it has been given notice on at least 3 prior occasions in the preceding 6 months that it is in breach and warned that further breaches may result in termination of this Agreement; (c) a Force Majeure Event persists for more than thirty (30) consecutive Business Days; (d) an Insolvency Event occurs in relation to the Supplier; or (e) a change of Control occurs in relation to the Supplier where the Supplier is unable to demonstrate to Worldpay's reasonable satisfaction that such third party is an economic entity of reasonable financial standing and that such change of Control does not increase the risk or cost to Worldpay in respect of the Services.
